Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. the park benches that i was mentioning
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

PAax6intTvzZFZJ5ORudyg.text: For a place that claims to be "Texas BBQ," the brisket was overdone and seriously lacked seasoning (and smokiness).   On the other hand, the turkey and tri-tip were seasoned properly, but were on the over smoked side. The first few bites were good, but then the ash tray like flavor one gets from wood that's smoldering and not completely ablaze set in. Overwhelming and unappetizing.   Sausage was snappy and spicy. Easily the best part of the meal.   Mac and cheese: super cheesy and quite tasty. Beans: ultra sweet and gummy. Potato salad: dry with store bought like flavors.   On the plus side, they serve sweet tea and all the employees were very friendly.   Even though it's close to my house, I'd rather drive the extra 30 minutes to Rollin' Smoke and get considerably better barbecue.  ***UPDATE***  Someone from Big B's responded to my review. Since I can't directly respond, I'll do so here:  I'm not suggesting that you undercook your meat. I'm not really suggesting that you do anything. If you want your meat to taste the way it does and that is your taste, so be it. I know the difference between meat smoked with wood that's completely combusting and wood that's just smoldering. Yours tastes like the latter. The first few bites are good, but then it starts to get strong and overwhelming.   Simple seasoning does not equal little taste. I tasted no salt or pepper or anything on the brisket. It wasn't bad, just lacked flavor.  Also, the turkey obviously at least had salt on it or it was brined (and there is nothing wrong with brining anything).   I don't think that you bought anything from the store, just that it sort of has a store bought taste. My main issue with the potato salad was that it was dry.   I, by no means, am trying to tell you guys how to do anything. I've eaten good barbecue all over this country, barbecue at home for myself, and have become spoiled with what I think is good. No offense meant at all. Obviously, you guys have a huge following and an overall great score on Yelp. Just here to give my honest opinion.

hQwlw9gNclkXeodfDZykQA.text: The restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly. The prices were very reasonable when compared to Rolling Smoke and Dicky's BBQ Pit. I tried the tri-tip, pulled pork and lean cut or brisket and thought they all tasted fantastic. I will come back again.

HAOPaMesMILpJg2yMi9yWw.text: Great BBQ place. The selection of meats is great, the cornbread is decadent, and do not get me started on the sides! Lol! The staff is friendly and beer is cold. The prices could be better, but the quality of the food really makes it worth it. Great place!

i9QDAcFhckOrr6qz_pYsqg.text: Brisket was good, chicken was flavorful but on the dry side. Excellent service. Great corn bread. Didn't have to wait in line. Price was good for meal we received.

dSFWCivSfuNFHy1wmkV-xQ.text: Wow a friend asked to go here for lunch and holly crap this BBQ joint is legit!... They have a killer smoker and their meat is top notch.... And trust me if I'm raving it's honestly worth a stop by!...   It's Texas BBQ.... they have 3 sauces and the hot is awesome!...  This ultimate sandwich had pulled pork brisket and a jalapeno and cheese sausage coleslaw and a baked bun capable of holding this all intact for you to bite it if your mug is big enough to handle it  Great customer service too good music and laid back atmosphere with picnic tables....  Just go trust me!....

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. YUM
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

A3MQngZ_yOCoDWle8DSWSQ.text: Came to Big B's today and was pretty impressed with the overall food and really good service. walking in the smell permeating from this place smells heavenly. Something about the smell of meat smoking for hours is just magical. For me really picky about BBQ and I can be somewhat snobby but I will give credit where credit is due. I ordered the 3 meat plate which consisted of beef ribs, brisket and baby back ribs. My eyes where way bigger than my stomach based on the amount of food and I was borderline hangry. After a very short wait the food came out and it smelled amazing and looked the same. The smoke ring on the brisket you can tell these guys have some care for the art and craft of great BBQ. I first dove into the brisket and had great smokey flavors and was super tender and delicious. after a few pieces I really wanted to get into the beef ribs. I love beef ribs and so many places don't know how to cook these right. For me these are the unicorns of great BBQ. Well they tasted absolutely magical as well. They where so tender and great smokey flavor as well.  After now being in a small meat coma I had to try these baby backs. Now they serve these bare which I like and you can dress them with their either spicy ( I would highly recommend), their signature sauce which was also delicious and a real treat a South Carolina style mustard based sauce. All of these were so good and can't pick a real favorite because they were all so good. The only ding I would give were for the baby backs. I love a traditional smoked rib and these while smoked fell off the bone which either shows they boiled them, cooked in the oven or left over from the day before. They were just OK for me and really not loving them all too much. They did have a nice smokey flavor they were just not my thing. If you like this style of rib you wont be disappointed....  Overall experience here was fantastic...everyone who works here is super friendly and I would highly recommend. This place is the real deal and the guys here really got it together. In a town that you are competing with casinos its worth driving off strip to give Big B's Texas BBQ a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Nice smoke ring
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. 3 meat combo with beef ribs, baby backs and brisket smells amazing.

zUlZ9APPE5sDzn70OpMaHA.text: Welcome to Texas....I mean Vegas!!!   ATTENTION tourists and locals!!!   I found this barbecue gem in May. Since then, I've dined here at least once a month. I've also brought my retired old guys group for a lunch or two.   Prices...5 Stars!!  Customer service 5 Stars!! Location...easy parking but gps maps are NOT accurate. I recommend the restaurant follow up.   Good prices on wine and beer.   Cleanliness 5 Stars!!   You'll sit down on wood tables and feel like your in your backyard chowing down the best smoked barbecue without traveling to Texas.   FYI...a large smoked sandwich will be two meals!!   I hope this restaurant sticks around!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. My FIRST time. I&#39;ll BE back!!!

pn4b7E6DgE7pWNzwz1ncwA.text: In town for business and a good friend recommended this bbq place. Great service and great food for dinner. Large portions and everything was great. The owner was awesome gave us some tri tip n turkey to try because we had everything else. Good sides as well. We will be back the next time in Vegas

JrvENhVQQjzTiZAGJWUYDQ.text: Wow, just wow. The hype is definitely spot on. It really is like Texas BBQ. Big portions, and again, just wow. I had the #2: Tri Tip and Chicken, both amazing. My sides were the fries, and they are fresh cut and perfect. Then I had the baked beans, again, total Texas badass beans. Loved it!!!! Will definitely be back whenever BBQ is on the radar.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Tri Tip and Chicken w/ Handcut Fries and BBQ Beans, all delicious..

27ifctvrU-iXKvDPN_6qmw.text: The best BBQ in town! I got 3 meat plate with chicken, brisket and tri tip! Happy 4th!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. 3. 3 Meat Plate

I-_RE3eRMXyLmmYJQDS3tw.text: The bbq chicken and pulled pork were good.  The sausage link and brisket were ok.  Wouldn't tell people to steer clear and if I were in the area at lunch or something I'd revisit.  It was good not great.

Qsgm-VBkryoM2_HLgD5PXw.text: This place is so great that my bf couldn't get his mind off of it! He couldn't remember the name or what street it was on but as soon as he found it on yelp we were on our way.  He'd been here a few years ago and knew that this place was going to be his go to everytime we came to Vegas. The ribs fall right of the bone, the tri tip was so tender, and the hot link was delicious. The mac n cheese was ok but the bbq beans were probably our favorite. They weren't too sweet nor too tangy, just right. The cornbread was good too, different from what we're used to. We will definitely be back!

Qhc2WDgie_b1H4Wr-GyTrA.text: Great bbq in the Henderson area. Service is fast and the food great. They have a soda machine that is different than others and the coke was super good.   Make sure to order the baby back ribs and the beans. They give a really good portion of everything and they ask if you want brisket moist or lean which is a sign of a True bbq place.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu

GfeS1YknGwuqhk-By1oxzA.text: Ever since we went to Austin, TX we've been looking for a good BBQ place and really enjoy Big B's. We ordered the brisket, tri-tip, and fried okras. The tri-tip had good smoke to it, but was a little dry (although everything was good). Service was great. I also loved the ambiance inside. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

_s7eMT8j-THcVehbrhDGZw.text: Food was good not great... brisket was dry and the beef ribs which you pay an extra $5 upcharge on plate orders wasn't worth it. They were burnt with to much char and not meaty. The side of coleslaw was bland, beans OK, Mac and cheese average.  The overwhelming smell of smoke (it's a smokehouse I get it) was a lot and had to come home and shower and throw our clothes in the washer. We tried it and no need to go back. We both agreed not worth the money.  Staff was friendly.

zXnkhsZhex9iwknqOaU8LQ.text: Easy access and parking off of St.Rose. Head left upon entry to order your food along the counter (from where you can see the kitchen).  Staff had great recommdations for beef short rib, which is only occasionally available. We enjoyed that and Tri Tip, which was tender but a bit on the dry side. The fixings were all good: fried okra, corn on the cob, mac'n'cheese and french fries.  Lots of picnic bench seating, moderate noise on a Saturday night, many young families.  Friendly staff bringing food out.  Nice Place overall.

XGI7wRvPOD2Hed23GwzJuA.text: My husband loves bbq and he thinks this is the best bbq in Las Vegas. I love the atmosphere, the food and service. It is excellent. The sides are amazing and large portions. My husband loves the brisket and my Mom says the pulled pork is the best she ever had in Las Vegas. We hear a new store is opening at Ft Apache and Sunset. We are excited as it is much closer for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Mom posed under Texas flag.

fakLU5qc0lea2BO-_yydEQ.text: Found this place while driving down the street looking for places to eat. The place is big and got lots of seating with 6 big TVs, great place to come and watch sports while eating barbecue. Here what we ordered the ribs, brisket, for sides potato salad, barbecue beans. Ribs where good they feel off the bone, The brisket was good to. I really didn't care for the potato salad, baked beans were pretty good. The bbq sauce was watery and they had some other kind of sauce that was kind of spicy that was ok. Meats good here bbq sauce really didn't care for it. if I ate here again I would bring my own bbq sauce. I still give this place four stars - 1 for the bbq sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

70DK7Rb5CWKcCUouflurhw.text: I called prior to placing an order for delivery and specifically asked the girl who answered about ordering burnt ends.  She told me to put this in the special instructions when I place the order.  My order arrived with everything EXCEPT the 2 orders of burnt ends.  I called this place again and the same girl answered and I explained I did not receive the burnt ends.    She stated this time that she put them on the ticket for the cooks but they must be out of them....why could she not tell me this before I placed the order? This is the level of customer service provided?  Very disappointed with this lack of customer care.  This is not the first time but I believe this will be my last time giving this place my business.  The food was decent and everyone who tried it did like the taste of the food.  The owner did message me and state that burned ends is not something they have on the menu or sell, so all employees should be aware of what this business offers.  So in closing, they do not have burned ends, the rest of the food is good so I recommend you try this place and leave your own opinion of your experience, I just had a group of people that really wanted burned ends and we were disappointed to find out it was not in our order and I now understand why it was not, they don't offer them.  Lastly I do have a LOT of respect for a business owner who looks at Yelp and replies, it shows a lot of pride in the business.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. My plate, baby back ribs, chicken, tri-tip, bbq beans, potato salad and corn bread.

1iBSq3IXBwlig545OgIUcg.text: I have always wanted to stop and eat and I am so glad I finally did.  The decoration and ambiance "Very Country" is incredible so put on the plaid shirt,  cowboy boots and enjoy the Texas Style BBQ Feast.  The Staff was very professional, brought food to the table in a very timely manner, and checked back to make sure all was OK and to see if we needed anything else.  The food, OMG the baby back ribs were so tender and loaded with meat, and the serving size filled you up enjoying each bight.  I love my ribs, baked beans and pasta salad.  You got to get it!  Yum!  I have been to a lot of ribs places and Big B's Texas BBQ is right up there with the Best!  A must go for the entire family or even after a sporting event, bring the team!  Great Job guys!  God Speed!  Jake Out For Now!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

_hwCeVzOTMCernGJ1K1xsw.text: This was, by far, one the top bbq places I have eaten at in the LV valley. Very pleasant atmosphere and service.

PvIJteWzSCaHuJAHiCVsOw.text: So yummy and very family friendly. Beer was cold and potato salad very nice ambience will definitely be back bomb.com

s11LSsH8UADdrpqsDcyFFg.text: It was my first time trying this place  As soon as you walk in you get that Texas like feeling!  It's really awesome I do love Texas however(bias)  We were greeted by Irma, her friendliness, eager to help and hospitality was unmatched to any other place I've been here in Las Vegas! The food was fantastic!!!! They know about BBQ quite well.  That was our first time at Big B's and we'll definitely be going back for some tasty and yumz BBQ The place is spacious, lots of seating area and they also have good drinks selection. Shiner Bock on tap def my favorite. If you love Texas BBQ you've got to try this place!  Thank you so much for the great time there.

i_7KIL2uHZCTVS7TrHjEFQ.text: Really good food, loved the place. its cute with picnic tables to sit at. the wonderful girl at the beginning explained everything and it was a great price too. Only complaint is that they only had 2 BBQ sauces to chose from on the table. They definitely need more! other than that we will absolutely come back!

y8-guteo13aedzTg28ORfA.text: I forgot to post this last time I was here: Delicious! The meat is amazing!!! I had the turkey last time and this round I went with the tri-tip.

MoUbzFj7hclwkeGDn_ITRQ.text: I started coming to Big B's in Jan 2019, the meat and the sides were easily the best in Vegas then; made me forget about Rolling Smoke or TC's Rib Crib.  That mustard BBQ sauce.. yes please... A L L  D A Y.  Easy 5 stars, but unfortunately, since about March/April 2019, the sides have dropped off.  The normally flawless potato salad isn't the same; as with the pasta salad.  Ingredient changes, different folks making it, tweaked based on customer feedback, etc. would be my best guess as to why.  I hope those original sides come back, it's what really set you folks apart from the rest; and the only reason why you dropped to 4 stars.

Jtuu2y_7ajQG2I8jWsOEoQ.text: Ok, I wanted to give them 5 stars because this is a great place but I couldn't.  I am from Texas and raised on bbq.  The meats are very good here.  The mac and cheese is outstanding.  Cornbread taste like a muffin and not the authentic square cut.  I like how you can choose lean brisket or moist (fattier) brisket.  Ribs are very good and so is the pulled pork.  To Big B's: I would suggest a more home made corn bread and not one made in a muffin tray.  Also, I had to refill my drink 4 times.  The cup is small.  Bbq cups should be big!  I was disappointed being that their was no pickles, peppers or onion fixin' bar and didnt even give me any on my plate.  I would suggest pickles being out by the drinks and hot sauce available.    That being said,  the place is large and clean. Plenty of seating, parking and super nice people/staff.  I would def recommend and come back!

AtwpdKJsvV7bvPQeNe0Dgw.text: Very friendly service but downhill from there - good coleslaw. However, fried okra, smoked turkey, baby back ribs and especially and sadly the tri-tip all over cooked (smoked) and dry. Was really looking forward to this - cannot see how people give this restaurant 4 stars. Owner has sent sent me private message telling me I was slandering them - sorry honesty is not slandering - When she came over to speak with us and asked if she could give us something else we politely replied "no" her husband was across the room loudly saying don't waste your time - he got angry because when I went to empty my plate in the trash he asked me how it was - I told him dry and he did not like that - however it was the truth - if you don't want an answer don't ask it may not be what you want

c85R-LCPI7oKvXjyeI2gzQ.text: This is by far my favorite bbq in the valley! The pulled pork is the best and all of their sides are to die for! The amount of food you get for what you pay makes it a great deal, I was eating my leftovers for 2 days!

1yFc0MmEc_JKxOWUJ8p3MA.text: I ate here for the first time today. I must say this is probably the best Texas BBQ I've had outside of Texas. I ordered the brisket, coleslaw, mac and cheese and it was delicious. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the overall atmosphere of the restaurant is cool.

8iI-TueYPoiF_ZHe90LKZg.text: I've been coming here since day one and the food here has consistently been outstanding. I haven't had one "off day" getting food there. Great service and the prices can't be beat.   I usually come and get the meat by the pound. Brisket, tri tip, or pulled pork and take home. One thing is for sure. I tell everyone I know that if they want great bbq to go to Big Bs.

QUGgmoljK9cJMEZ5AzVyvA.text: Sooooo good!! I am a BBQ gal & this impressed me beyond belief. Anywhere that has beef bbq has my heart

N5hhxVyWSxIW0LOQPSp2wQ.text: Great smoke flavor to a very moist turkey breast,  very tender tri-tip and fall off the bone ribs!!  And they have Shiner Bock on tap!   Good stuff!

6rrcyg8ugF95yCkYo_ysjg.text: Some of the best BBQ in town. We live in the far NW but making the journey was completely worth it. The moist brisket was some of the best brisket I've ever had in my life. Reminded me of Rudy's in Texas but better. The mac n cheese was the wife's favorite but the beans were amazing. The wife and I travel to Texas and KC specifically for bbq. Kind of embarrassed something so delicious was in our backyard but we refused to drive across town. We look forward to returning soon.   On a side note.. the food was amazing but the staff was also super cool. Definitely got the southern hospitality down.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

UrUfMnD4lJCDFG8InDHV8Q.text: Good food, good prices nice big dining area. Brought some friends to try it out and was not dissapointed.

ck_fqJ1XE8Ia3OqzMDFfDg.text: Love this place!! Best bbq I've had in Vegas!! Everything taste great and the service is awesome!  If you like great smoked bbq this is the place!

LKhlczLELmnY3TU1HkvtLg.text: For the most part, all I eat is vegetables, salads, brown rice, fruit and nuts. But every once in while I get this craving for baby back ribs, coupled with good potato salad, slaw and some green beans. Guess, it reminds me of my childhood but it is so hard to find. Took a chance to try Big B's and it was delicious! The meat just fell off the bone, their sauce is tangy, the green beans where nice and warm with a little garlic, everyone who I spoke with there was really nice and the service was quick. So now I know where to go when that craving comes. Thanks.

8seF4WdBp-o0u0MepSsyPg.text: Being from Kansas City and spending a lot of time in Memphis over the years, I'm a picky Eunice when it comes to barbecue. Big B's is legit. They do it all well, from the best brisket I've ever had, to unbelievably tasty and perfectly charred-on-the-edges tri-tip, to the fried okra and pecan pie. It's a delicious meal. Go shove some awesome food in your pie hole at Big B's ASAP. You won't be sorry.

ZhttYaKHkVLY3YM7kiKYjA.text: Read a lot of reviews and this place was great.  The food was fantastic and good size portions.  The price is very affordable especially for the amount of food you get.  The pulled pork sandwich melts in your mouth,  the fries are cut fresh and made to order. The corn bread wasn't traditional but it was moist and delicious.   The establishment is very clean and the staff was very nice. I would highly encourage you to try it.

qJIuqFyO6R2wdIwEhgp7PQ.text: This is my favorite BBQ restaurant ever. The wonderful smoky odor hits you immediately upon entering. We were greeted cheerfully by all who were working. Their decor is wonderfully relaxing. But best of all, the food is so amazing. From the pulled pork & tri tip, to the best creamed corn, fried okra, coleslaw... boy, I could go on & on. Do yourself a favor & get over here. You'll be so happy you did.

FVMqPkOY3yHZifS5JwZU5w.text: We've lived in Las Vegas for thirty years now. This is the first time I've felt like I was in a real Texas bbq joint! The brisket is amazing! The atmosphere is so authentic you would not realize you're not back in good ol' Texas. Dang, I can't give this place enough accolades. Perfect. Great music, smells like good food cookin'. Gonna take home some pecan pie for later! Oh, and the staff was friendly too! I don't wanna leave.

vjs0wreNjJNWWWT81vlFRQ.text: We walked in and ordered a special platter meal which came with chicken, brisket and sausage and two nice proportioned sides. Everything was so good. I just did not care for the chicken, it had no flavor of any kind where the other meats where awesome. Also, dessert here does not match a BBQ food joint at all. The cake comes from Sam's Club at a high price per slice of boring non-homemade desserts. No mouth happiness there in that area, I must say.  They had great customer service though and the wood table decor was awesome.

dJWUuHrIcXieIY5iJx8b5w.text: Every time I come to Big B's the environment is very welcoming and I have to order something different each time. It's really hard to keep going and eating the same thing because everything is so flavorful. The brisket is juicy and tender. The ribs are very delicious and my go-to. Besides remind me of a good old-fashioned family get together because it's all made fresh.  The sauces that they offer at the table are very delicious and not overpowering at all. I travel all the way from Aliante just for Big B's.  If you're into barbecue you need to definitely go visit them for authentic barbecue.

9TUiQE418wkbXlfn41whMA.text: Amazing BBQ. CompArable to eating in Texas. Quality of the brisket is superb and the Side dishes are all great. Customer service is awesome as well, employees take pride in the food they serve. They provide samples if you are unfamiliar with any of the meats.

tKNd997UkBkaskbQqVPV2g.text: Worst bbq I ever had the rib are boil in water and then place in a oven to bake no smoke no taste at all the fries where cold and just two pieces of bread that was dry out and the corn on the cob was just plain nasty not place to go if you are a looking for good bbq place

UDeo9bSAP_ofTaTfz0ZlUg.text: This place is great! I love all their meats! One of (the many) best things about this place is that they don't drowned their meat in sauce! They allow you to taste the meat and awesome flavor first before the sauce hits the meat! Real BBQ with real flavors!! They have 2 flavorful sauces...I like them best mixed together! Going here is a must! If you want BBQ and can't dine in or take out go to BiteSquad.com and order delivery!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

KqP_vUvrnOq-mjYJscBXQQ.text: Amazing barbecue!  The chicken was phenomenal!  The sides are delicious... particularly the mac n cheese and the bbq beans!  We will definitely be back again!

HS1hAPXMPU5FB3FqXHEpQg.text: I tried the 12" poboy with brisket. The meat was tender, but dry. I asked for the hottest sauce which turned out to be a mustard sauce. There wasn't enough sauce for the dryness of the meat. I tried to order the mac n cheese, but they didn't actually have it available. So I got the slaw and the potato salad. The potato salad had very big chunks of potato that were hard to eat without cutting and some chunks weren't cooked all the way through. By the time you add the brisket upcharge and tax, my total was $17 before tip for sandwich and salads. Too expensive for such low quality. The only thing saving this place is the employees were nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. 12&#34; poboy with brisket and mustard sauce, slaw, potato salad.

oeaAunXMN5TJFFUi5JkiQQ.text: We lived in Austin for five years and had our share of great to fair BBQ. This rates up there with the greats like Franklins and Rudys. We are rather picky, and this place is outstanding.   This is the most authentic Texas experience you will find outside of TX for BBQ. Sit at picnic tables, rolls of paper towels, smells of BBQ smokehouse waft thru air, served on butcher/wax paper and trays. Sweet Tea and Shiner is on tap.   The food is great: Brisket, chicken and ribs and smoked turkey. Sides were really good: BBQ beans, creamed corn. Portions are very big.  Service was excellent. Everyone there was friendly, and very hospitable, including the owner.   Can't wait to see this place continue to thrive.

-qt3p9tQOGbqG0mWRaWo_w.text: Great place, staff is always friendly, and the place is always clean. The food is really here, the price is a little high when you first look at it but when you get your food it's well worth the money. I've been here 3 or 4 times and I bring my friends with everytime when we have our military drill weekend. I would recommend the 2 meat if you're really hungry if you are looking for something to just eat get the 1 meat you'll definitely have more than enough. The sides are really good as well, their cornbread and bake beans are the best in my opinion. Overall great place and very good food. A bit pricey but like just said the food you get makes up for the price.

gCyEy1TlNkQby070080mfA.text: For those who have never had Texas style BBQ this is the best spot for it west of Texas itself. The pulled pork and tri-tip were excellent and I can't wait to come back and try some of the other items on the menu!!!

HwtCrD-qnTsTRGNN8_FJzg.text: This place has the best Mac & Cheese!  Loved the Tri-Tip and Brisket  and hands down best customer service!  The owner looks like Channing Tatum and he's awesome so that's a plus

wjXOCwegMvp1pm2oMYBarQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere. If you are an avid weekend bbq/smoker person you'll appreciate the food that this place puts out. Not too bad on price, fairly comparable to other BBQ joints out there but always nice to go to a small business and support. Service is nice as well.

fztK8NytpiMhN6UHOQ-EFw.text: Man oh man, this place is awesome! Prices, location, and interior are amazing!!! I got the 3 meat plate with tritip,turkey, and brisket....delicious!!!!

LgLASgSX37Q5YwPHmvpHAA.text: Big B's is easily my favorite BBQ in town after just one visit!   The meat is tender and lean without all the extra fat.   The Mac and Cheese is phenomenal, but watch out--there's a kick to them!

Xfmdv2E_jUUZz0fu4_yVjw.text: Smells amazing when you walk in the door. We were hungry before going but smelling the food when we walked I made me starving lol. Ribs awesome, pulled pork delicious and brisket tasty. Had sides of Mac and cheese, BBQ beans, fried okra and corn on the cob. All yummy. Great to find a good BBQ place in Henderson. Recommend to anyone who loves BBQ. Will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby back ribs
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Pulled pork

J0EKD5JdIt-L9_2MGTiVjg.text: The ribs are delicious! Tender, grilled nicely on the outside & fall off the bone.  The baked beans are amazing...yes they were that good! My son is really picky and he loved the mac & cheese & pulled pork.

6ZQlcAr_Gl4mvtXvfIZJKw.text: Very yummy food with a bbq picnic atmosphere! The meats are very tender and flavorful. Plenty of food to feel full and price is reasonable. Staff is friendly and helpful. The owner cares about their business cause he walks around making sure everyone is ok, need anything and most of all SAYING HI to everyone there.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy food! Great atmosphere! Friendly staff and the owners walks around making sure all is ok and most of all SAYING HI!!

PS_vJQBHwEwFRJ-BLJrKDg.text: Delish, all the way around.  The meats, the sauces, baked beans, mac n cheese, even the pies were all great. Been here 4times now, and haven't been disappointed in anything yet. And I love the convenience of being able to order and pay ahead of time

-rrZDXKUDLT1qPZPQBHOAA.text: Finally found a great place for BBQ.  Even better that it's close to home!  Great service and the owner was wonderful as well and is very personable!  The meats were cooked perfectly and the sides were delicious!  Will be back that's for sure!

y_f4ST7tqnmaZo7L0HnjPA.text: Food 5 Stars; Service 2 Stars. The beef was wonderful! I was a bit surprised when they came out with a tray with some meat and two slices of white bread. I asked where the sides were and she said the fries and okra would come. Fries came, I asked about okra...they said it was coming up.  I completely finished my meal and no okra. So I informed them and asked that I get banana pudding togo in its place. I waited a few minutes...they brought me (only) okra.  After I was finished with my meal, it was too late for okra...it got cold and went in the trash.  It is a 20 min drive from me, if the service had been good, I'd probably go back...but I don't want to drive that far for poor service even if the food is good.  Too many good places to eat in Las Vegas to put up with that. (By the way...they had 4 employees and 3 tables at the time). 13 July about 1120.

b5FqeJxrrvG1XmAlEhD0JA.text: Wow the ribs are so good you can't get enough of them , the bbq beans are the best I have every eaten . Nice place lots of tvs to watch the owner comes by and make sure everything is ok . The device is great and yes the food is very good.

-VvUwyHbxmhc0Colht2wKA.text: Barbecue so good it doesn't need sauce. Mac n cheese was super creamy and delicious. Brisket was moist and tender, pulled pork had some nice caramelized bits in it. Poor boy bread was soft and flavorful. Fried Okra and home style French cut fries made fresh when ordered. Had a great dining experience. We ate like royalty for under $20. Ribs are smoking good!!!! #WeWillBeBack ;)

upfMn_CejpA4f47o9aiEPg.text: The pork ribs and brisket was a little on the dry side compared to another well known BBQ place I've been to. The corn on the cob was also dry. My wife had the hot links and fried okra and she said that they were good. Not in any rush to go again.

mWp1BDdQIdPfHtzzefMDig.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Love the use of all the reclaimed wood.   Had the baby back ribs, the brisket and the creamed corn.  All great dishes.  Just opened a few days ago so I'm sure it's going to get even better.  My 6 year old says the rubs were even better than mine!  Not sure how I feel about that.

LL-OLf8X2eUZH9bd6Dk8ww.text: Great staff great food. Wonderful job catering our baby shower for a little less than 100 people. The sides here are just as good as the meats!

qjEGX8AOAXd1I2k178FRfg.text: We ate here at 2PM.  We each had a half rack of ribs, coleslaw-me, potato salad-her and baked beans.  The ribs were nicely done--fell off the bone; the cole slaw and potato salad were fair and the baked beans were pretty good. These are dry rub ribs so there's no sauce on them at all--you can add the very vinegary one on the table but it was not to our taste. The big problem for us though was the smoke in the place--it was horrible!!  I've been in forest fires that were less smoky. My hair, skin and clothes were completely permeated and my clothes had to go to the cleaners to get the smoke out. Far too high a price to pay for a rib dinner. I would never go there again due to the smoke which they said only happens when they take the smoked meats from their ovens. Why not vent to the outside?? Crazy!

NChj2ZaUy2q7gg4dUIvJyw.text: The only thing I didn't care for was the corn on the cob, it tastes frozen, definitely not fresh but the the tri tip and baked beans were delish!

SFjW--r2VcI7jpgZ4dOMcw.text: Authentic Texas BBQ. First class owners in Brian and Natalia that take great pride in their quality of food.

zuhZoYw8rTM6B8LEUQB6kg.text: As recent transplants from San Antonio we've been looking for a good barbeque joint to replace our Texas favorite, Rudy's. Big B's is very comparable. We shared a #3 with tri-tip, moist brisket, turkey, potato salad, and barbeque beans. We've already made a list of what we want to try on our second visit (po'boy, ribs, fried okra, jalapeno/cheese link). We'll be doing homestyle take-out when our out-of-state visitors arrive.

I18P-pGRKOxw3EKjomwJCg.text: we ordered the 3 meat plate with a side of potato salad and mac/cheese with a jalapeno hot link order on the side.  plenty of food for 2 and tasted great!  the corn bread muffins were the best!  great staff as well, first time there and the staff at the front was totally helpful and recommended what to eat perfectly.

gqK8pquEn2BAauwVLGAWxA.text: I'm from the Midwest and we have great BBQ there. This place is one of the best I've had in a long time! Great location and great food! Their pulled pork and chicken we took home. The BBQ ribs were fantastic! One of my new favorites!

ygm6OY-suy1T-HDYrH5Q0g.text: After living in Texas for almost 10 years, I got spoiled on Great BBQ. After moving to Las Vegas and searching for a good BBQ place I thought I would have to go back to Texas for good Beef ribs and Brisket. Them this place opened. Not only is the food great,  the staff and owner are very friendly.  The place is not as busy as it should be. This place is worth every dollar spent

3bP7vMHWrNGC9lZ1-8xSww.text: Stopped in here not really knowing what to expect and it blew me away. It feels like a good ole smokehouse with picnic benches. I bought the meat plate chicken , Sausage, ribs and the wife got the brisket. The service and food was great. I was a little disappointed with the BBQ sauce selection as I could only find one bottle on my table and like it more spicy but the meat was cooked perfectly.Great food, great service and great prices for BBQ I will be back!

cp3aaUwe1_q2VSH1olAFBw.text: Just left Big B's and wanted to give the owners the review they deserve.  Absolutely delicious!! Great size portions and flavor served in a friendly welcoming setting with happy staff and an owner who genuinely cares and takes pride in his food and restaurant.  The 3 meat plate was waaaaaay more food than I could come close to eating.  I was happy with the quality of all the foods and flavors offered.       The owner constantly walks the floor to make sure you are enjoying your meal and offers to refill your drinks. Everyone in our party was beyond satisfied and will definitely be returning.  It is amazing that people have bad things to say on yelp once they leave, yet in a place like this restaurant where staff and owners are more than wanting you to enjoy your meal and be accommodating you sit in silence to go home and complain.  From an honest man I say make the time to stop in and try this restaurant and hope that you enjoy it as much as we did.

PQU-Er8fiInYJGMZ9KNiCA.text: First time here. Big portions. I ordered family style. I had the pulled pork and smoked turkey. Tender and juicy meat. The quart of fry filled its own food tray.  We ate until we were full and now we have leftovers :) the service was very warm and positive.  This place is hidden behind Canes, looks plain on the outside on the inside it smells like hickory smoke and has a fun atmosphere. We need places like this in the seven hills area. I'll be back with my family and support this business.

24tC2vNdtMBS-cT_XUVhRw.text: Thee BEST BBQ in all of Las Vegas - hands down! Definitely a must for locals, from the friendly and polite staff to the savory, tender ribs falling off the bone; you're certainly missing out if you have yet to come by!! Hope to see more locations soon!

Q88lVrhpbv4lKTx57fVI3Q.text: Amazing find, thank you for the great food. Walked in here by accident, left satisfied.

re0f563nlmIBYj3wvrhVOQ.text: My BFF and I were looking for a new place around home.  We just happen to see the sign from the road and thought we would give it a try.  We each ordered the 2  meat plate which comes with two sides. He ordered chicken and tri-tip with mac & cheese and bbq beans for his sides. I ordered pulled pork and brisket, with coleslaw and bbq beans as my sides.  We each ordered a side of cornbread. When ordering the brisket I was asked if I would like it lean or moist. Anybody who has had brisket will know the difference! I ordered the moist which has more fat thus giving it more flavor. We were very pleased with the quality of food and the generous portions. The coleslaw is outstanding, and I consider myself somewhat of  coleslaw snob!  Unfortunately they had run out of cornbread and offered us either an additional side or a refund of our money. We each ordered an additional side. I had Mac & cheese and he had French fries. The owner came by the table to see if everything is okay and I told him they were out of cornbread, which was disappointing as I love good cornbread. He seemed genuinely miffed at the fact that they had run out stating that should never have happened and apologized profusely. The atmosphere is pleasant, Comfortable and friendly. He has hired on a great staff who seem to take the job seriously and genuinely care about a positive guest experience. We will definitely be back

ZPU9dhlENkAqXMewqCjFEA.text: This place could be a 5 star rating but needs to fix a few things... The main one being that the current menu on their website says that a 3 meat plate is $15.99. It's not. It's $2 more at $17.99. Big Difference! Come on people! Three of us went to try it out last night, first time for all of us. It was good. Between us we had (and I tried everything): tri tip - it was moist, good and I would get it anytime. The brisket - moist, good, fatty piece on top that I'd expect. Smoked turkey - VERY good. I'd get this every time. Cheddar and jalapeno sausage - good, but VERY spicy. I eat jalapeno poppers etc, but this was much hotter, so be warned. We also had creamed corn, mac n cheese, and fried okra. All very good. The least fave was the creamed corn. It seemed that it was too thick, we were there about 6:30pm so maybe it had sat there too long on a warmer, not sure. But way too thick. I thought the plates should have come with bread, but we didn't get any bread with ours, and were never offered bread. I thought from other reviews we would get a slice of bread, and since we paid $2 more than the menu price I would have thought we would get a slice of bread but oh well. The other small problems: 2 of us wanted a glass of draft beer. The lady said that for a dollar more we could get a pitcher and it would be about 5 beers. So we got the pitcher and it was exactly 3 cups of beer. So she was either told WAY wrong or they are trying to upsell by lying. Not sure. But I guess it is still a deal. But for just one more beer I wouldn't have got it. Also the sauces... They have a sweet sauce that has basically no hot spice, and a honey mustard. I like a little more kick though. I asked the gal that brought our food if they have something a little more spicy and she went and got a chipotle sauce. Ok this was like fire in your mouth. They need a regular spicy bbq sauce. I sure hope the owner reads this and fixes his website and the small things listed here to make it a better place.

-7SLyIDFHXwgCUXlreJw3A.text: Awesome, I tried the brisket meat plate, with fries and potato salad, my partner had the trip tip with beans as a side, of the sides I enjoyed the beans the most, they were very well seasoned. Brisket was very nice and moist. Their sauces were both on the sweeter side but not overly so, i enjoyed them even though I normally go for a spicier style it was a nice change. Great experience overall the staff were very friendly and helpful with ordering. My only regret is I wish I had eaten there to enjoy the ambiance and have my meal fresh and hot.

WZDmw6NW765HrN56kbu2CA.text: This was our first time eating hear and my wife and I  both enjoyed it the owner and staff  where  friendly. Our meals arrived in a timely manner.

9yTkUKg8YYoqDKG_-TWmBw.text: I've been looking for a place to rival Rollin Smoke in the Henderson area, if you are too, this is not the BBQ you're looking for.  I was torn, I really would rate is 2.5, but for the sake of it being a new business I'll round up. I got the three meat plate, brisket and pulled pork and  upgraded one meat to a half slab for $4.  It's decent, but not flavorful enough for me. Maybe it's the type you have to drown in BBQ sauce (they offer a mustard based and a ketchup based, of the two I prefer the ketchup based) and I only got one of each to go.  I like my brisket on the verge of falling apart and this wasn't tough, but it wasn't about to fall apart either. The ribs were fall off the bone so that's a plus to me.  The mac N Cheese is excellent, better than most BBQ spots. The creamed corn is good too.  I always try a BBQ place twice so hopefully the second time is better than the first. More flavor in the spice rubs please!

jst7iXNL5PKWhP7xj1-gTQ.text: Best BBQ this side of the Mississippi.  Clean, friendly, the Ribs were PURRFECT.  As was the Trip Tip and Brisket.  Sides were great too, but the corn could be a little creamier.  This is definitely a once a month visit.

WMaua88YEL_mTYY6Ji023A.text: We tried the ribs, tri-tip, brisket, and sausage along with some sides. The tri-tip was the star, all agreed. Leaner than the brisket, but with a great smoky smooth flavor. The ribs were great as was the brisket. They had tons of different sauces to choose from...I liked the spicy Texas sauce the best..it was kick! The reason for the 4 stars were the sides...very disappointing! The potato salad was weird, coleslaw we all tried and nobody liked, the beans tasted like they were in a bbq sauce soup. Very heavy and overwhelmingly not good. Prices are steep, meats are great, avoid the sides...

h7v4uhQl91WoJg_vAsbYxw.text: The BBQ spot is absolutely the best I've tried so far from the exceptional customer service to the quick servicing of the lines, and to the quality of the food.  Delicious?  That's an understatement.  My family's new favorite BBQ headquarters!  What's a plus is, for all of my 2nd Amendment Folks, I talked to the manager and they allow open carry!  They are a TRUE AMERICAN restaurant!  Thank you for your awesome customer service and excellent food, all while allowing your patrons/ customers to practice their freedom!!!  You guys are awesome!

ypQWklSHWA69X10TKQY-2A.text: The location and a few of the staff are outstanding in helping out. I got a couple of the 2 meats plates with drinks. The place is very hip. You sign everything on an iPad and when you tip they ring a bell and say something about beers tonight.  The sit in area is very Texas with benches etc. very well done everything.  Now with the food. I love brisket and I couldn't more disappointed. It was way over cooked and chewy. Must've been a bad day for the cooks. I also got the smoked meetloaf and it was smokey and red in the middle. Must've only been smoked to 110 degrees or something. It had good potential, but was gross. The best thing honestly tonight we're the French fries. I'm giving it 2 stars only because the people were beyond nice. I would never recommend this place. Good luck to the rest of you.

DHxslNCwTB51eZJGoMZA3g.text: It took me awhile to finally get to try Big B's BBQ and it was totally worth the wait. I went all-in on the brisket, turkey, jalapeno/cheese hot links, baked beans, potato salad and corn bread.  Absolutely delicious!  If you love Texas BBQ, this is your new home.

lzcLwFiciXhPU2CZ0ncMDA.text: Omg the cornbread is too die for. I made the trip all the way to St. Rose for the cornbread. The ribs fall off the bones. BBQ is a hit or miss but this place has it down pat, and is a hit. I will be back. My son even said it was bomb. Now that's unusual.

2iOKo_2V5LKGQFbPpSPljg.text: I finally got to swing in for lunch with the homies. I was a little apprehensive at first because there was only a few people at lunch on a weekday.  We were greeted with a big smile by the owner who walked us through the menu. I opted for the beef ribs cuz that's how I do. For sides I chose Mac n cheese as well as coleslaw. They were both really good. While we were waiting the owner brought out some free fried okra which was really well done.  We chatted a little and she offered to gives us some of the mesquite wood they use. Super nice.   Everything was very clean, food was great and I look forward to going back and trying the chicken!

Xgg8pZxaB3PuYvgVBjCcTg.text: This place is pretty good. This is the closest to authentic Texas barbecue, that you will get in Vegas! This is coming from a girl who lived in Texas for a few years!

2vU10pxkT9IDGCDpfrCRQQ.text: Hands down best barbecue.  I was overly impressed just walking in.  Coors light on draft, decently priced, great food, great atmosphere.  I wish I could give more stars.

4DEUJcuKm3wmFcu3pUBDGA.text: Living in Texas for many years one grows to appreciate truly amazing BBQ. And when moving away will spend many years trying to find anything close With most places just winging it at what BBQ should be. Well, no more searching and wishing for authentic Texas BBQ. Since the owner brought all this directly here from Texas. Everything I have tried is over the top Texas perfection. Try try try

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Big piece of heaven.

Sk-f3mv0-OKA5a1P9wkyCQ.text: I like this place. They have only been open about a week, so still working out the kinks but my visit today around 11:30am on a Tuesday was a very pleasant dining experience. Their hours are 11am to 10pm.  Its located just west of the Hospital, very close to Raising Canes, on the south side of St. Rose Pkwy. Parking lot is big, plenty of available parking.   When you walk in you see a lot of wooden picnic tables (12) and a few tables made from wooden spools in a very large space. Plenty of room for everyone! They have several large screen tv's around so you can watch sports on them. They do serve beer, as well as the 100 flavor soda machine, sweet and regular ice teas.   Their menu is pretty extensive, brisket, tri tip, baby back ribs, pork loin, pulled pork, chicken, turkey, links and more. They do meat plates (1,2 or 3 choices), sandwiches, etc. Lots of sides to choose from.   I went with the two meat plate ($13.99) with brisket and tri tip (where's the beef? on my plate!)  with a side of corn on the cob and BBQ beans. You get a couple slices of bread with that as well. Good old family style BBQ plate with plenty of food. I liked the fact that when you ordered the meat they pulled a section out of a warmer oven, and sliced it for you. For me the tri tip was delicious, moist and a good smoky flavor, although a bit on the cool side temperature wise. The brisket was chopped, and my serving was a bit dry and not as good smoky flavor. Reading other reviews I think its worth another try. The BBQ beans have two different style beans in a sweet sauce with jalapeno (?) and big chunks of brisket. The corn on the cob was not burnt like in other photos here, had a touch of smoky flavor, just needed butter. Two sauces, one a vinegar/ketchup base and the other a mustard base were on the tables. Neither sauce wow'd my personal taste buds, but worked nicely with the meats.  I had a nice interaction with the serving staff, they were all friendly and helpful. The owner Brian had just left but his kind wife was there to answer a lot of my questions and even took me back to show me the smoker unit. They have a multi-layer smoker, use mostly mesquite and oak woods, and maintain temperatures from 225 to 250. She said it takes a bit getting used to this smoker and cooking times, so I expect as they continue to cook it will get really good. She also told me they started off with one rotation of meats and found out they were running out around 6pm so now they do 2 rotations. Pretty much someone is there 24 hours a day. The entire back area was clean and well organized. They actually drive to Texas 2 times a year to load up on wood as its hard to find here or really expensive.   I'll be back for sure. I look forward to a great sample of the brisket, as well as trying the porks, ribs, and chicken. Prices are fair for Vegas. When you tip, the entire staff yells out "Beer Money" so tip well.

aR16K9BPHPyu02yTYQaRiA.text: Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Delicious food, portion sizes were sufficient. Restaurant was clean and organized. Next time I'm in town I would come back here.

FYFW9TwJSTfX0-gBAzmRFg.text: It started out okay then they sold me $40 worth of ribs with no meat but they replace them I didn't go back for a month now I'm back and they try to double charge me for my ribs the same exact order that I've been getting for $36 they tried to charge me $54

fbadBOBQuxozEr8ijZJazg.text: We went here to check out the Route 91 memorial. My husband was a survivor and it's one of the only memorials he wanted to see.  We ate here and it was amazing. The staff was so friendly even with my crazy kids running around. The brisket was mouth watering. Thanks Big B's for supporting Las Vegas!

yTceEi4aXaSweQcBcPqe5g.text: Ordered this through postmates on a whim and omg is it crazy delicious amazing bomb BBQ explosion in your mouth!!! Bets BBQ I've had in Vegas and I'm so glad I finally found a place that knows how to make tri tip correctly. Seriously. God bless you people.  Sincerely, Your newest addict

lj0WCFyCHKVNnBOcYu9QHg.text: Best Brisket in Las Vegas!! (And it's not even close).  For the past several years, there seems to be a plethora of BBQ restaurants poppin' up in the Valley. And each one claims to have a different regional style when it comes to their BBQ, and many places carry similar items, but done with their own personal taste. While there are places doing good ribs (Rollin' Smoke) or good pork (Jessie Rae's), there is not one single place in town doing good brisket. Except today, when I went into Big B's Texas BBQ.  I saw this new business when Heather N. checked into here. Always on the lookout for good BBQ, and I noticed it was close to where I was at the time, I noticed it was around lunch, so I had to get my grub on.  It's located behind the Raising Cane's on St. Rose Pkwy, there is a lot of parking so don't worry about it. After walking in, I knew I was in the right place. Even though there is a little bit more finishing up when it comes to the interior, it does scream Texas style BBQ. Sort of like that BBQ place that was on the King of the Hill cartoon (Sugarfoot's?). Anyways, after ordering some meats, paid my bill, then sat down.  Brisket - Man.. that is some brisket. Not only the best brisket in Vegas, but one of the best ones I've ever had in my life. I'm sure a Texas BBQ connoisseur would probably be more qualified to talk about the subject, but I really like a very tender brisket, and that is what is missing from all the other spots in town. There is an actual 'smoke ring' that you can see on it. It wasn't plain or dry. It was truly a spectacle to behold.  Tri-tip - I had a old friend who attended UT at Austin back in the day, and I asked him if tri-tip was as popular as brisket. He said he really didn't see it that much. I did some research and found out that it was more of a California thing. But the way that Big B's does tri-tip, Texas should think about adopting the tri-tip as part of their BBQ style, because the one at Big B's is phenomenal. Absolutely tender, and it just melted, and that smoke ring doe.... I was just floored.  The sauces were great as well. I personally don't like a BBQ that's so sugary sweet, I liked that Big B's was more about spice, and subtle amounts of sweetness, and complexity of flavor. There are two of them, a red and orange colored one, and I liked swirling both of them, and playing with them on top of my brisket and tri-tip.  Texan's know their beef and Big B's knows how to cook it correctly. If you're tired of dry, flavorless brisket in Vegas, I would definitely recommend this spot. I would also like to see some reviews by some Texan transplants to see if I'm right, or just crazy. Probably just crazy.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. 1/2 pound tri-tip (look at that smoke ring)
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. 1/2 pound BBQ brisket

jcppLqysShfUAjDRMK4xug.text: Being a temporary transplant from Texas, I am constantly on the look out for some good home flavors.  We actually had the opportunity to taste some Big B's Texas BBQ at a Hurricane Harvey Fundraiser at Casa Shenandoah.  We enjoyed it then and kept meaning to go to their restaurant in Henderson.  Last Friday, our opportunity arose.  The entire experience felt like home...from the Shiner Bock to the BBQ and sauce.  The brisket was done to perfection with a smokey ring.  It was melt in your mouth good and definitely not dry.  No sauce necessary!  I also had the hot links which were delicious.  My boyfriend had the chicken and brisket and said both were great.    To be honest, the only thing missing was the slice of bread or bun, sliced onions and sliced pickles that you ALWAYS get with Texas BBQ at home.    We will be back!  Thanks Y'all!

AuNUfrXsVCJGXxUAjQdbhA.text: Haven't found much to be excited about in BBQ places around Henderson. Then I stumbled onto Big B's, not only is it close by, but I'd drive a ways to eat here. The first thing that hits you as you walk in is the aroma, something good is cooking. The tough part is then deciding what smells so good that you don't want to order the wrong thing. After numerous visits I can say it's all as good as it smells! If you've been eating ribs at chain restaurants you'll wonder how Big B's finds pigs with more than twice the meat. It's not fancy but it shouldn't be, good food at a good price.

_GjyCX1OmEl_ha6NrsoQ1w.text: Smoked brisket and smoked turkey are delicious, beans have great flavor so does the Mac and coke slaw. Very good food. Highly recommend!

cBCkWTcXkodT3qbXD_5OoA.text: Great customer service, I haven't eaten the food myself as I don't eat meat but my kids and significant other love the food. Received a recommendation from a coworker and have been almost once a week due to request ever since tge first visit. I can say that the fries are great!

TlZOep3dOYKU_ulLytf3zA.text: Ordered catering from here.   Amazing brisket.  Melts in your mouth with great smokey flavor.   The ribs and pulled like are also amazing. Just like in Texas.   Beans have huge chunks of meat in them with it ended flavor.     Pricing is good and can feed the whole family for lunch and dinner 2x!!!

lNKnVo9CY_RiLp90eHRmaA.text: Found my new favorite Texan barbecue place when I'm in Las Vegas (Technically this is in Henderson).  They have beef ribs! Not every bbq restaurant has beef ribs due to the cost, so I am always on the look out for a place that serves them.  The brisket was juicy and flavorful and they have beer on tap.  My wife and I split a meal and it cost under $25 and we are so full!

HL5aLWDoyD7r36vwIi7t7Q.text: I thought this BBQ spot was average. Nothing stood out, but nothing bad to say. I ordered a two meat plate; smoked turkey and baby back ribs with baked beans and mac/cheese.   I had to send the mac/cheese back, as it was extremely watery. It also lacked flavor. The server was very nice and advised there were several patrons who had sent back their mac n cheese for the same issue. So, not sure if it was a bad batch. Why even serve it?   Turkey was great! Very moist and flavorful. The baby back ribs were dry.   The staff is very nice and professional.

4OLKnRJ3-o3vxEkGYQbLXQ.text: Best bbq I have had hands down in this town!!! Meat was flavorful, juicy, & well seasoned!! Atmosphere was kinda quiet. The owner is from Texas so he knows good bbq!! The mustard Carolina bbq sauce was awesome!! We live on the other side of town & we will definitely be coming back!!!

eDVArgb3dsrjPrNNtmikHw.text: Yes! This is wonderful food. And amazing service. From the moment we walked in the door I felt like everyone wanted us to have the best experience. We will be back again and again. I couldn't even begin to tell you what is my favorite. All of it!

m5DWcX0KRYs-pKEHDBt7oQ.text: I've tried this place several times now, but with mixed results.  Pleasantly, this time was quite good. I ordered the tri- tip with beans and Cole slaw as my sides - a Number 2 plate in their menu terminology.   The half pound portion of beef was sliced thin which helped make it fork tender to eat and was moist and delicious. The beans were served piping hot and had abundant chunks of burnt ends mixed in a combo of two or three types of beans. One drawback for me was the sauce for the beans was overly sweet - I would like to see a spicy version offered with jalapenos and a less sugar based sauce. Cole slaw was unremarkable.

sFOynXM3ArLFlQuBL8Q0Ag.text: My first time. Stopped by yesterday late afternoon to pickup an order. Full rack of baby backs, two sides. The baby backs were excellent,, the meat fell right off the bone.  My girlfriend had the corn on the cob......again very good. I had the mac n cheese but just could not figure it out....not what I was used to.    Will probably come back again and try something different next time. Service was very fast.  Prices were reasonable.

tBF2Jq-fVatUzbUf2LJu6g.text: We have not had brisket this delicious since we lived in Texas. Perfect pink, smokey ring, super moist. I unlocked the free side and it allowed me to try one more delicious side, the creamed corn. All the sides were super delicious, though! Even my picky toddler loved the pulled pork and fried okra! Sweet tea was on point and hubby enjoyed a Not Your Fathers root beer tall boy.

Wzv0J8sdFK73Sk9Q-NBK0g.text: This is now the second time I have been here and once again the food is amazing! This is up there with real BBQ in Texas! The tri tip and brisket is so flavorful and moist! You barely need BBQ sauce with their meats! You can smell their smoker inside and outside of the restaurant! The mac and cheese is also amazing, great flavor as well! If you show them the yelp app, you get a feee side! Service is also great, friendly and personable! The only negative thing about this place is you have to drive all the way cross town to get to it since I don't live in Henderson! I wish this place nothing but success and a very bright future!

PGtl2FuZyL1bSKxSQLc6-g.text: Great food and the tastiest BBQ that leans more towards the healthy side. Great place for large parties and very affordable for the quality of food and service.

NOOea2sKg35uJWwMkjH1vg.text: Food was alright... I wouldn't say I would go back, not saying I wouldn't.  My husband had the tri-tip and ribs combo with Mac and cheese and corn on cob for the sides. I had corn on cob, fried okra, corn bread, and Mac and cheese.  Neither of us liked the mac and cheese and ended up throwing it in the trash. It was over cooked macaroni with too much sauce. The corn had absolutely no flavor, even after adding butter and salt! The corn bread was served room temp to almost cold, normally I would expect it to be at least warm.  Staff was very friendly and husband did enjoy the tri-tip. The atmosphere is very clean and nice for its guests. So overall, it's average and I am undecided.

GpDszkj-3xrL81qGM3bv-g.text: The bbq was good, but it wasn't great!  I had the three meat platter that consisted of chicken, ribs and brisket.  They serve the meats dry (without sauce) on a piece of carving paper.  The meal included cole slaw and a corn muffin.  The results:  The chicken was very dry and needed to be drenched in sauce to allow it to be edible.  The ribs were good and very smokey.  They were cooked perfectly, but needed additional sauce.  The brisket was sliced very thin and had a nice smoke ring.  It also needed sauce to enhance the flavor.  The sides were average, but the bbq sauce was very flavorful and the best part of the meal.

Sg7eqGiGstbO_LxtemCH-A.text: Every time I've gone there I've had a good experience. The barbecue is delicious and the meats are very moist.

S1Zy-xLiwcF_E7PkVWl1tg.text: For those claiming they had the best brisket in their lives, settle down.  The tri tip was pretty good but overall this place is average on TX standards - I guess add 25-30 percent premium bc it's Vegas.  This place is decent - I'm prob more harsh bc if you're gonna have TX BBQ in your name I expect them to back it up

mojf-qaIqcI_pa26I-WBew.text: The absolute best BBQ we've ever had!! The brisket fell apart it was so tender! The sides were great too!! You can't go wrong with this place! Love it!!

-M_pG_tkuRhMP2Y6t7VX7w.text: Everything's good! Delicious pasta salad mmmmmmm!!!!

zs6-MOQMqYG0olwYTVR8Xw.text: First time dining here, advised by many friends, glad I went, great barbecue, outstanding service and good prices. Barbecue beans were best I ever had, ribs were excellent, coleslaw was very good, owners were there working, very personable and locally owned.GREAT JOB

otZUklE7oh9P7IgjAIrA3g.text: Had the pleasure to try the beef ribs here and they were legit! Very comparable to Phil's BBQ in San Diego. The standard sauce is amazing and the spicy sauce is delicious also!    IMO, it is better than Lucille's and Tucky's, though at Tucky's they don't serve beef ribs.   I look forward to coming back and trying the brisket and tri-tip.  Hope this interview helps you out! Enjoy! I know I did and will do in the near future.

TU9BE5F_JDf488kYDqkuVw.text: My brother wanted to try out this place and so we, as a family were in on it. The place is awesome and so is their customer service. The food looked and smelled delicious but it was the taste that was lacking. The meats were dry...the corn bread, well personally I prefer a freshly baked cornbread. Their sides were better in my personal opinion. Again great place/atmosphere but the food wasn't much to brag about amongst friends/family.

2FBhIVqXfReyUc1fU6qX8w.text: We went here for the first time tonight and all I have to say is amazing. The service was top notch, the atmosphere made us feel like we were back in Texas, and the food was hands down the best BBQ we have ever eaten. Will definitely be back!

9Xg3Qh6pH4qCZIv4a3rOSQ.text: Tonight we brought 14 teenage boys in from the basketball team for dinner.  They all ordered either the chicken, pulled pork or brisket. most of them had the macaroni & cheese for a side. Everyone of the boys came up and thanked us for the meal and said they wanted to bring their parents back to eat.  Thank you to  Brian and Natalia for the AMAZING service. Your staff went above and beyond for our group tonight.  Looking forward to our next meal at the best BBQ in Vegas!

sk-vq_BcgQ4ZT_G68e3pUw.text: Save your money and go next door to canes. Spent $62 to feed my wife and small child. We ordered the cold brisket, the  1/2 rack of dry ribs, and the soggy corn on the cob with the silver dollar sized cornbread that was also cold. Not sure where all these high ratings are coming from but we were both pretty disappointed. We've eaten some of the best BBQ in south Texas and was kind of hoping to find a place in Vegas that's comparable, guess we'll keep looking. Wouldn't go back if the price was cut in half.

ZEQkm_KPnLT8-GjBRUHsNQ.text: This place is excellent!  The owner walked around, asked everyone how their food was and refilled guests drinks. Excellent food!  We had brisket, ribs and pulled pork. All was fabulous. Okra was cooked to perfection!  Fries are fresh cut and great!

zQPj0AdkVu7JlyZzx-t3Qw.text: Finally a BBQ joint in my neck of the woods that rocks!  Had the following: Brisket- easily the best brisket I've had in the Vegas area. 10/10 Babyback ribs- excellent!  8/10 Mac n cheese- 9/10 Baked Beans- 10/10  The one thing I'd recommend is to have a spicy BBQ sauce on the table along with the BBQ sauce that's there.    I'm now a fan!  Returned for a second visit. Inconsistent is the key word.  Ribs were dry and brisket didn't resemble the brisket the first time around.  The benchmark for ribs has been set by Fox Smokehouse in Boulder City and by Jessie Rae's in Vegas n Henderson.  The ribs failed to meet those standards.   Was very disappointed by the inconsistency on my second visit and therefore adjusted my rating.

_J4Dx8Gu9YF2JPCCsvCPAA.text: First time here, tri tip, brisket, Ribs all were great! Sides also Definitely recommend

RVzHRmKj_WvdQnSZ94G9_Q.text: This place is the best! They helped me twice pick out the perfect combination of foods and quantities needed for gatherings. Everyone loved their food and sides...the ribs, tri tip and brisket were big hits, as was the potato salad and mashed potatoes. Pretty sure you won't go wrong with anything they prepare!

PUjWXMpNuXjZDmv9bny2jQ.text: Just went here tonight (7/1/2017) right before closing and to our surprise the staff treated us as if we were the first guests through the door. Exceptional customer service and all around amazing food. We ordered the brisket po'boy and tri tip plate with mac and cheese and cornbread on the side. Definitely the best BBQ in Vegas that we've experienced thus far. Hats off to the owner and staff, can't wait to go back. Will definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

4FIErEGA1-Es3fj--j1QIQ.text: Came here right when they opened at 11am on Sunday. They were ready to go. Very friendly staff, well designed, comfortably lit dining area.   Food is ordered at counter and then brought to your table. Food is served on trays with paper, disposable silverware and cups.  Tried almost all the meats besides the ribs and salmon. Sliced tri tip was great, chicken leg quarter and turkey were moist, brisket tender and moist, hot link was a normal hot link, pulled pork was better than most places.   Fried okra was fresh, very well seasoned, super good. Mac and cheese is more white in color, smooth, creamy, with no processed cheese flavors. White or wheat bread came with our plates also.  The two sauces offered were unique but good. One was tomato based, one mustard, both were on the sweeter side.  No complaints. We'll be back to try the ribs!

DBMe-O8ZsR0LVB4tVE0kKQ.text: We ate there today and everything was AMAZING!!  When u first walk in you smell the amazing smell of BBQ!! All them employees were friendly and easy to talk to!!  Everyone needs to check this place out!!  The sauces on the table were great and mine fave was the mustard one!!! The pulled pork,  tri tip and brisket were my great but my favorite had to be the jalapeno and cheese sausage!!! All I can say is it is a MUST TRY!!!

q2z16YbIu204oYv-V4NcoA.text: Best BBQ on this side of the Country!! We had a two meat combo brisket and tri tip. And the Cole slaw was good too! My wife had the smoked meat loaf and baked beans and we both Straight Murdered all are food. Thanks we will be returning

DGUYOl2WvrsE0iV5vs0p1Q.text: Wow... Really really good pulled pork sliders. Mac and cheese is amazing as well. I was very happy. You need to eat here. Yum!

YP42c1dHgcvrA7IdbCeWHQ.text: Great bbq, and the best french fries ever! Very casual, stand in line to order, big picnic tables. Very friendly staff and affordable. Great place to take a group.

g-TtzeiY1Dl4QiIGCDw7Zw.text: Place is good, however they were out of ribs and pulled pork. Someone was pissed about them being out of ribs and yelled at the kid taking the orders so they manager asked him to leave then came around and apologized to everyone in the restaurant. Manager is nice. He said that they are still working on knowing how much of each item to prep each morning without having a bunch of left overs at the end of the night. We had brisket, tri tip, mac n cheese and potato salad. All items were good. They also have a coke machine with over 100 flavors.

cBGq4KOjTY5xd0FXVAtgig.text: Love this place!  We moved to Henderson from Fort Worth, TX and tried a lot of the BBQ places in town.  Didn't care for any of them. Then, we tried Big B's...love it!  Me and the family go at least once a week to get our "fix."   All the sides are great, too.

AKAbUwr918k4_XRVFtcixw.text: AWESOME BBQ! Their fried okra is amazing too. Everyone is friendly and the service is prompt and accurate.

bUkLmjFv8KzKAb-VSWMvAw.text: WOW! I love barbecue and this is great food at a great price! Huge portions. Great sauce. Love it.

avdRNf3b7JYxdgWMFgqwHQ.text: Soo good!!!! Great food and the people are the nicest in town. I will come back for sure!

qtkf3p5bweeLyYMZ4catMA.text: Parking, never a problem Service A++, always with a smile, and a clean restaurant. You can see the food being prepared a HUGE plus Food A, the food fresh, hot plus a great aroma. Fries, the best I've ever had; ribs super tender, tri tip succulent; beans, make you want to slap yo' momma good.

uqeaRSLno6tb4gPZRJDngQ.text: I tried this place for the first time today. The food is amazing! The baked beans are probably the best I've ever had and the ribs are really meaty and have great flavor. This place has great food and is very reasonably priced. We will definitely be back.

STP4Nifhx1Nl0vI2fyiRQA.text: Had a 3 meat meal. Tri tip, pulled pork and brisket. I chooses the moist should have chosen the lean, none the less good BBQ and good service.

CBIbK2zWGGCKRhVvKmkA2w.text: Had this 3 days ago & it was bomb!  Ordered again for lunch after I told everyone how good it was at the hospital & it was disappointing. Portions were much smaller than the first time( maybe coz we ordered for a group of 10+) & they were going to charge 15% delivery fee even tho they don't really have delivery service yet & we we're just across the parking lot! Might have lost some friends over this!

izgJ0LTAMPczPet5JTreBg.text: Excellent service, excellent bbq...surprised us. Highly recommended. Owner greeted us personally. Five star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Done...will come back
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Fresh fries
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Before and after...fall off the bone

dUZ9e5Kxl_jD8YBgGou__A.text: All I can say is WOW!!! Finally amazing BBQ in Vegas! I got so Fed up with subpar barbecue in Vegas I bought a smoker and started cooking myself. Now I finally have a place to go to where the barbecue is far superior than anything that I could cook or is available in Vegas. You know they're serious about the barbecue when Big B drives to Texas just to get his wood! What more needs to be said! Large portions of perfectly smoked meats, amazing sides, and multiple types of sauce........ Pure BBQ Heaven!!! My two absolute favorites are the Beef Ribs and the BBQ Beans. I'm actually getting hungry while I write this review.... So I'm on my way over. Damn that's twice this week! Keep up the good work Big B!!

j_dVwKdq1Qj6AxYFddQk3A.text: We had a coupon, so, we gave it a try and where not disappointed at all! My wife had ordered brisket, and before she could even bite into a piece, the manager came over to our table and asked that he please replace the brisket because of how it had been cut. THAT, is paying attention to detail, and the brisket he brought to the table was outstanding! Me, I had ribs, and I must say, they had been prepared perfectly as well! We will be back, with friends and family.

XIljcUWPZ576yFeDQZYibA.text: We had a Memorial Day party catered by Big B's Texas BBQ. Twenty four guests attended and to the person the feedback was excellent. Brian, the owner, gives wonderful customer service and is easy to deal with. I do recommend Big B's to anyone that appreciates real BBQ.

z4NtQg-6cPt2_bVl6agysA.text: do not go to this dive  , i got a brisket sandwich bread was very nasty cole slaw was nasty , potato salad  also nasty  $ 17.50 in my garbage  can  once again .... frign waste of time and your money very  very small portions

FPu0MIUBLurfdco4MP_AEQ.text: Good BBQ, Country Music, Beer and Picnic Tables.  Super friendly, great service and the owner walking around chatting with customers!

8NpqjcX-rD4Iru9YiHs5aA.text: Best BBQ in town . Ribs are to die for. Got to give it a try service is amazing.  Will be making it a weekly place to eat.

MYj351Jqg4GEJ9CLAZb4vQ.text: This is the kind of barbecue place that locals deserve. I have tried places across Las Vegas and Henderson and this is one of only two that I return to regularly. You can't go wrong with a two or three meat plate. The brisket and pulled pork are staples of my meals. The fried okra is second-best only to my mother's. We bought our Thanksgiving dinner here and it was a hit with everybody. The owners and staff are great and we try to come at least weekly.

488otz1717fuYL5eDQbN2Q.text: I'm from Texas and I thought I'd check out this, so called, Texas BBQ. It was overpriced for the amount you get and they charge you an extra 5 dollars to have ribs on a combo plate. Why? The cornbread was aweful. Who puts cinnamon in cornbread? The BBQ ribs and brisket were good, but not worth the price.

t2cRaf-C3PVelrUCbDIRxg.text: Some of the best smoked turkey and tri-tip I've had. Mac-n-cheese was on point. True southern potato salad. Only thing I wasn't fond of was the cornbread. Too sweet and not made with cornmeal? But otherwise this place was definitely worth the 20 minute drive.

s3EKqEq160Ru7-0lfERxsg.text: I am actually from Texas, so I mean it when I say this BBQ is something special!! (See my Pot Liquor review). Every time I come here I am more impresssed than the last. This is really great food, generous portions and good prices. I can't say enough good things. I always get the brisket po-boy with mac and cheese and corn on the cob. The brisket is full of flavor without any sauce and melts in your mouth...the True sign of good BBQ, even the bread is fresh. The mac and cheese is amazing even when reheating and the corn is a full cob. Only thing that could make me love this place more? Banana pudding, blue bell ice cream and bbq baked potatoes. Keep up the good work!!

w4jCuJTYCoGTB6p-BS3EtA.text: Ordered the brisket, mac and cheese, beans and cornbread. The brisket had as much fat as meat and the taste was the same, if not worse than some of the chain bbq places in town. The beans were ok  and the mac and cheese tasted like a watered down version of Kraft.

gTSDyjVg8Gv5xDHh7Fc6IA.text: GREAT FOOD!!!! The REAL DEAL!!! Friendly staff and a nice atmosphere, they brought the outdoors in making for a fun and laid back feel. The pasta salad is light and refreshing, the beans are superb, cornbread is muffin-like, Mac n cheese is legit really really good and all the meat is perfection. Best ribs I have EVER had. Sauces on the tables are unique and delicious. Overall I left fully satisfied and bummed I live too far away to eat here weekly.

rndsF4WbST816bhZtb2SFg.text: So tonight we ordered BBQ in and have been to Big B's before...again we were not disappointed. They make everything delicious.  The smoke, the beans, the flavor, unmatched!  This is the only place to go.  Brian you are the best!  Thank you for all your hard work, it truly shows!

QLrixgTagoFgzUgRus-Weg.text: Coming from North Carolina I didn't think BBQ could get any better but this food is even better than the BBQ at home. If anyone wants some good BBQ then I would recommend this 10/10

j3mKkLFOKqAyYiobcdvO3g.text: Been waiting for this place to open. Heard great reviews from people in my area decided to check it out for myself. My husband, daughter, & I ordered the plates as they're the best deal #1 plate with one meat $9.99 comes with 2 sides & bread. Brisket is hands down the best I've ever had! So tender, melts in your mouth! Not dry or over smoked. Perfect flavor. The pulled pork was very good as well. I'm not a cream corn person but it was incredible! Met the owner Natalia who was very friendly. Great, casual atmosphere! Felt so comfortable here & saw lots of families.

7IQkT9xiFVHpbK0dYEVz2A.text: This place is so cute! It has a great atmosphere and all of the food looked great. I tried the chicken and it was pretty good. Very juicy and the bbq sauce was yum!! The french fries were also fresh and very good. The staff was polite and the service was fast. My only complaint was that I thought it was was a little pricey for what you got. Maybe if the plate meals included a drink and corn bread (you only get regular sliced bread), I'd be happier. Overall though, I'd recommend and will be back!

MnPm4ttmFok9sKjqI61XIw.text: Enjoyed eating here! The food was delicious.... Service was awesome and the set up inside is cool. The portion was worth the price.  Definitely coming back here.

flFlzE-dvDg8wtQYTBOixw.text: If there is one thing I know it's bbq... Bravo to the owners for awesome service and the tastiest Bbq in vegas.

UgekUtakEth9Zq8um5521A.text: Fantastic food, fantastic hospitality and fantastic atmosphere.
