1jgQtAhz_ugzk5rAzAcZdQ.text: Deceptive...  Looks like a crappy strip mall joint from outside...but when you walk in and smell the bbq, see the brick and hear the country music...we'll, it's a slice of Texas here in Nevada.   Oh yeah...the bbq is good too!

ljpHu1f0rIj0mHeBBrEguw.text: Hands down the best BBQ joint in the area. You can't ever go wrong with the brisket here. ALWAYS moist. Fri/Sat they have this Flintstone rib. Not sure how much meat is on the bone, but it's well over a pound. Mac N Cheese is well Cheesy. And finally it's refreshing to see a place that actually runs out of meat. That tells me it's a well run business. Made to order and sold til gone. How many times have you been served the previous days leftovers in your life? We've all been thru that in our lives. The reheated piece of leather. This place rocks!

xgClzhIy6g7J9lyGqiZhlQ.text: Delicious Tri tip! Came here after a big hike in the Red Rocks to satisfy our ravenous appetites. The very casual decor made us, in our dusty appearance, feel comfortable. We trusted the positive reviews and it we were not disappointed. Meat was the main attraction -- tender and delicious. My son also enjoyed the chicken and brisket.

GEDl-lPUiDbGc5-HQYz9dQ.text: This should be 5.0 stars for the tri tip alone.  I have never had such flavorful, juicy smoked tri tip in my life.  We ordered a half pound of the tri tip, a half slab of ribs, Mac n cheese,  coleslaw and French fries.  The only disappointment was the ribs.  They were very dry.  Should have told them but we were so full that we didn't need more food to replace them.  The servers were all outstanding.  If we lived in Vegas this would become a regular place to eat.  We will be back and next time just order a mess of tri tip!

7aSPOwoUpiRw-Bi4yl5vKA.text: This place is worthy of 5 stars.   We walked in and realized it's cafeteria-like ordering style.  We were promptly greeted and was told, all the ribs just sold out and they won't have it again until tonight.  Immediately turned me off, because that's my go-to choice of meat.    Contemplating whether to go with 1 or 2 meats, the lady told us it would about 4 ounce portions per meat.  I went with the brisket, tri-tip, corn on the cob and coleslaw for my two sides.  My husband got the tri-tip and the turkey breast.  The turkey is actually slow cooked for 7 hours and who knows what process the rib and meats go through, since they ran out based on popularity.    All the meats were neatly sliced, no fats trimmed, just in case you're into that sort of thing.  The meats were lightly seasoned, and perfect if you want to add your own sauce.  Amazingly, the meats were so tender, you can just use your fork.  We tried the two type of sauces, for the sake of trying it.  The verdict, the meat alone is the star without any other sauce.  Great tri-tip, awesome briskets, most surprisingly, is the tender turkey (cashier said it was her favorite).  Corn on the cob was wrapped up in foil and there's nothing cool about mushy kernels.  I unwrapped it, well seasoned and I cut away with my plastic knife.  Mmm, yummy was my reaction and it wasn't even mushy or soggy at all.  Thank goodness.  The slaw was again lightly seasoned, not too much of anything.  The plated meals also comes with wheat, white and I think rye bread.  Nothing special, just sliced bread that appear to be Orowheat of some brand.  The decor is your typical Texas BBQ joint.  Nicely done with wooden benches, round tables for big and small parties.    Finally, a BBQ joint that is good, not smothered in sauce, so you can taste the meat.  The cuts of meats were good and hardly any fat on them.  I'm no connoisseur on grading meat, but this was delicious BBQ.  This is a real gem in Henderson.    The icing on the cake was when a manager/owner asked us about our meal.  When you care that much to simply ask, you get honest feedback.  If there is happy hour prices, we might consider gathering co-workers after work.

Ux_ThaPu2kP8zeB7t2S6hA.text: How can this place ALWAYS be out of something on their regular menu. Smoked Meatloaf. Came here at 5:15 pm. Saturday. 3 strikes you're out. Bells BBQ right up the street. Sorry  Natalie, no one there has EVER said it was taken off the menu. The person behind the counter said you ran out ! Nice try !

qVHqolFrK7RcTJ_YhsixsA.text: Great meats! However, in my humble opinion, the sauces need some development. Won't keep me from coming back, tho.

5Jb9M_uF8_YnEovBNI2-bA.text: The inside of this restaurant is beautiful and well thought out.  The food is pretty good as well. We ordered the brisket, pulled pork, cornbread, Mac and cheese, and creamed corn. Personally, I'm all about the sides! The Mac and cheese and creamed corn were great! The corn bread was lacking some flavor which was a little disappointing because corn bread is a huge staple for BBQ food.  The brisket was okay but it was on the fatty side which isn't my favorite. While we were paying we were looking at their desserts and asked if they were homemade and one of the employees stated that they were bought at the store and that they wish they could bake. It feels wrong that they are buying store bought cake and reselling it. Why not hire a baker?Overall, I would only come back for the sides which is a little disappointing.

r0UmhSZ9M84cs1AohJr-7A.text: Decent BBQ, I and absolutely love the vibe. I do denote one star due to the pricing. It seems BBQ prices in town have gone up by 10-30% over the last couple of years. We came here for lunch with a $10 off coupon and still spent dinner prices. I would come back if in the area and absolutely craving BBQ, but I will not be placing Big B's on the normal restaurant rotation. I got the try tip and the hot links and loved them.

2FhaQVQuwV07bixq1B_D2w.text: Great BBQ! Had the ribs and tri-tip and the meat was falling off the bone. Great friendly service. They came.by several times to ask us if we needed anything and provided ample tale home dishes. Would recommend to anyone visiting Vegas!

U6wrg5jso7yPCiiIdcE_XQ.text: Short Review:  We have everything in Las Vegas when it comes to food. A couple of years ago, a ton of sushi restaurants were opening like it was going out style.  "Hot and New" donut places, poke bowl spots, burger joints, coffee shops, and BBQ restaurants can be found are all over Sin City.  We are definitely spoiled and the food competition here is fierce.  With all the different BBQ restaurants out here, it's very tough to determine who is best. But when it comes to a really good brisket and tri-tip, Big B's has to rank up there.   Not So Short Review:  Bookmark Checked!! What the heck took me so long to eat at Big B's?  I remember reading Michael K's review about their brisket and immediately bookmarked Big B's.  This was over a year ago.  I finally got the opportunity try Big B's a couple of days ago and came back again today.  I was disappointed and impressed at the same time. I was disappointed in myself for not coming here sooner and impressed with the food. Michael K. was right about the brisket.  Big B's brisket deserves all the praise that it gets.  You get the option of lean or moist brisket.  The lean brisket is good and I didn't find it to be dry like other Yelpers have stated. The brisket is so tender that I had to eat it with a spoon. Their moist brisket is perfection if you prefer a fattier piece of meat.  If you're one of those Yelpers that thought the brisket was too dry, then get the moist brisket next time.  Another highlight for me is their Tri Tip and Beef Link.  You really can't go wrong with any of these choices. I have tried most of their sides as well.  My favorite is their creamed corn and BBQ beans.  I'll take my brisket or tri-tip and dip it into the BBQ beans.  Oh my goodness, it's good.  The prices are fair.  You'll get more bang for your buck with their multiple meat combos.  The combos come with two sides and they definitely do not skimp on the meat.   The restaurant is named after the owner Brian.  He's the Big B.  The service is great and the employees keep this place clean. The restaurant is also very spacious with picnic style benches all over the place.  Big B's is big enough to serve a large party and still quiet enough to enjoy your meal.  It took me so long to try Big B's because it's located so far from home.  Good news, though.  According to the owner, Big Brian is looking for a spot near our hood. In my opinion, Big B's has some of best brisket and tri-tip in Las Vegas. That's just my opinion.  Peace!!  2017 Yelp Review #78

bu7H1RQrpLoTRLkkxaEIAA.text: The BBQ scene in Henderson is getting even hotter!! Big B's Texas BBQ is now open! And this place does Texas style bbq BIG and proud!  --Menu-- Portions are BIG and Value is BIG  The Plates or Sandwiches combos - each comes with choice of two sides.  1 ($9.99) - 3 meat ($15.99) combo plates, the latter a pretty good deal!  Meats - Brisket, Baby Back, Tri Tip, Chicken, Smoked Turkey, Pulled Pork, Pork Loin, and Hot Links order Ala Carte 1/2 or full orders   Some side choices I saw: corn on cob, creamed corn, Mac & Cheese, baked beans, potato salad, slaw, and salad greens  --On My Tray-- 3 meat combo with brisket, pulled pork and spareribs. Great smoky flavor in the 'cues. . My favorite, was the meaty spareribs! Brisket was good, real lean, moist, but not as tender, just a tad tough for me. Pulled pork was more leaner as well.  Comes with 2 slices of plain, fresh, white bread too. Is that a Texas thing? So no cornbread or corn muffins? I noticed it's MIA on menu.   -amended so after bringing home leftovers,Mr. B noted I didnt get brisket ..but got trip tips instead..no wonder there was no fat...but trip tip slices I got were tough.   Cream corn is irresistible! Get it!. The bbq served had barely any sauce. Bottles are on the tables, so you can control what you want.  Brian said the two bbq sauces on the table are mustard based (small bottle) and ketchup based (larger bottle) both have more peppery note in it with the smaller bottle with more spice and heat.   --Ambiance-- - cafeteria style fast/casual When you order, check out the menu on the wall and tell the guys what you want, go down the line, pick your sides and pay cashier at end of the line.   Bring you lunch money!! AKA CASH!! for now since their register is not online as of this review/  BIG pluses -  Family friendly, plenty of BIG screen televisions, plenty of seating. Dining area make up is communal-style, the get to know your neighbor way. With BIG, long picnic benches throughout. Really nice spot.    - The "B" in Big B, must stand for "backyard" because this place is BIG, like a huge backyard.  - The "B" actually stands for Brian the owner. Just look for the tallest BIG guy there. Cant miss him. Really nice guy too.  --LOCATION-- Main access entry from St Rose Pkwy just off Eastern, Raising Cane's is your visual cue.  Pretty sure you can also access off Sienna Heights if you dont mind wading thru the parking lot where the medical offices are.  --Summary-- Still in soft opening mode, ( we were there 4th hour in)  so keep that in mind people. No paper menus were ready to go yet, hours not posted on door but was told daily hours are 11am - 10pm ...and like I mentioned above, bring cash for now.  Lovin the diversity of barbecue joints we have in our city. Each with something special to offer. In less than six months we've had a couple of bbq joints open up and there is still one more I'm stalking!  Happy to have Big B's Texas BBQ here! Time ya'll make Henderson your destination for barbeque! It's all good!!

1o_AukonF50GgHJt6B28og.text: It was that time of the month -TEAM LUNCH MONTH.  Since it was summer we decided to try a BBQ place, since we had been to Bells Bbq we decided on Big B's.  First the positive points. Nice and big inside, full menu board and menus.  Our group tried a variety of items , smoked turkey , chicken, brisket, baby back ribs , beef ribs, potato salad.  We even had a vegetarian in our group who had the Mac and cheese, fries and corn muffins.  Let's start off with my order the beef ribs and smoked turkey , potato salad and baked beans. The potato salad had a good flavor but was full of really big chunky potatoes which I had to pick out. The baked beans had good flavor but a little watered down like they were trying to  stretch them. The beef ribs were the WORST I've ever had. The other people in my group liked their smoked meats and did not care for the Mac and cheese at all.  I would only return for the smoked turkey and to try the brisket. Oh yeah and Paulo the cashier was the best !

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

iOopq0dDI-RmWj1-qy4b9g.text: I have mixed feelings about Texas BBQ. My first baby back rib order was 2 wks ago, that was really amazing. Tender and moist baby back rib. So, I decided to buy more ribs for my family event. However, the same baby back ribs- were just too overcooked and extremely dry...so, most of them went straight to the trash.

I-ik77aTA6QfVx66akuIFQ.text: Five stars for the brisket.  The most delectable. Juicy. Perfectly seasoned. Moist. Smokey. Savory.  Brisket. EVER!  The rest of the meats were forgettable, but the brisket makes up for all of it. The beans are delicious. Along with the Mac and cheese. The tritip.. ehh. I've had better.  Take the safer route and order the brisket!  With the mustard sauce. Mmmmm... Oh!  The chicken was pretty good too. Try the spicy yelp sauce!  Great customer service. Comfortable seating. Looks much bigger inside than it does outside. They have that red Coca Cola machine that comes with every possible drink option. AND - They serve beer. What more could you ask for?

hZFl0xEDvGxDVco9F53rUQ.text: Had a big birthday gathering there, the staff was very accommodating, and the food was wonderful. I would definitely recommend it to people!

i0Muz7dgScu2NyHRtqhpXA.text: Amazing food! Ans the owner who is from the great state of TEXAS is super nice! Will be back next time I'm in Henderson!

QZAdkVLuo0PsPAPkknqNsg.text: Meats: 3 meat plate and 2 meat plate, consisted of Beef ribs, Baby back ribs, brisket and hot links.  The beef ribs was not as juicy and flavorful as the baby back ribs so we will only get baby back ribs going forward.  The brisket was tender and both that and hot links were juicy and flavorful.    Sides: Both plates came with 2 sides so we got mac and cheese, fried okras, and potato salad.  We saved the mac and cheese for our toddler since she was asking for mac and cheese which led us to go with bbq for dinner.  However, the mac and cheese was kind of dry.  I ordered a corn bread and when we arrived to pick up our food, I checked in to yelp and with the check in I got a free side.  I believe they comped that corn bread and gave us another one.    Conclusion: This bbq spot is spacious, lots of seats, and walking out of there I could smell the smoke on my body.  We like it and will return to satisfy our bbq cravings.

vW6pmIkcnPp2zFhWZZXP0A.text: I absolutely love walking inside Big B's Texas BBQ because of the smell of wood fire.  And not mesquite.  Brian personally brings the wood (oak, I think) in from his family's farm in Texas.  The smell takes me back to the five years I lived in Texas, and the wonderful Texas BBQ.  Country western music is playing and the decorations are full-on Texas.  It's just a good place to be.  The food is good; it's quick.  They offer Shiner Bock on draft.  IMHO, any BBQ restaurant that doesn't offer a bock has a big strike against it.  Nothing goes with BBQ better than a bock.  I almost never order pulled pork, but I had the pulled pork sandwich today.  It was good.  It was huge but the bread does squish down nicely so that you can actually get it into your mouth.    I've complained about their fried okra since Day One and today is was truly over-cooked.  But dip it in the sauce from the BBQ beans and it's all good.  Service with a smile while eating comfort food, listening to CW music and sipping a Shiner Bock.  Life doesn't get much better than this.

jZys22Y18_TTsCtxhmAaWg.text: Go away Memphis, go away Rollin Smoke, go away dickies....I will drive 25 minutes to eat here. This place is possibly the best bbq I've ever eaten. I found out about this place from Route 91. I've eaten here twice and both times were great. I usually get the beef brisket with spicy bbq, Mac and cheese and fries. I recommend this place to picky bbq eaters.

9IcNLjsV_-8eU7BNKC3Wug.text: Great food! Even better service! My brother and I shared a 3 meat combo and we had so much left over. We chose brisket, tri tip, and baby back. All were so good. They gave us free corn bread to try and they were delicious also!

TgPxuJCs45mLgT5s1EIrvA.text: Brisket = YUM omg it melts in your mouth. You have to follow it with your hand because it is falling apart on it's way to your noodle. The beans were a bit spicy for me, but they told me on IG that if anything is not perfect, say something, next time - they would have fixed it or replaced it.  The brisket, cream corn and cole slaw was my fav.   They are super friendly, super quick and very nice. I love this place and I cannot wait to go back.   Oh and get a jug of their homemade BBQ sauce to go!! It's freaking amazing xoxo thanks Big B's.

k078Kstra9eg-Dv8EITk4w.text: This place is awesome. I heard they import their wood just to smoke the meats. Everything I have tried except the cornbread has been super tender and tasted great. The cornbread was much to dry and did not really taste great at all. The service is always  good and it's usually not too crowded. The seating is a little annoying but I guess it goes with the theme of the restaurant.

Ymcqnl_vkzp_pyK-DmeLPA.text: Cute country decor, great pulled pork and ribs, Mac n cheese is yumm too! Good deals to feed entire family

zaN0WY2FtZyf4DmVBWRg3g.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!! ESPECIALLY PABLO the manager. He has great customer service...This restaurant is clean and the staff are friendly...I visit often and order the brisket, tri tip, potato salad, and bbq baked beans.  (taste like my uncles grilling at my family bbq) I dont miss home as much with this place around the corner. THANKS PABLO!!

WxHMCekkMQk8JFT1oRfNMg.text: Our family has always loved Big B's Texas Barbecue so when it came time to have a small to large gathering for my Marine son, I could think of no other venue than Big B's. And they did not disappoint. I ordered these huge platters of food and Irma made sure everything was out and ready to be served. She took care of us from beginning to end, making sure sure everyone was happy. Her assistance allowed me to enjoy time with my son and the 20 other guests that came out in support. I will absolutely never forget how gracious the entire staff was, but especially Irma. A million thank you's ....

u0oTtcMJF6lDRE3fYc0Hyg.text: Solid BBQ. Reasonable prices. Good for lunch or dinner!

HtgLBTx9h3Li5z_KXaX_gA.text: Meats are delicious.  Smoked turkey wasn't dry at all and it was tasty.  Brisket was perfect ratio of fatty part and meat.  Tri-Tip was perfectly cooked that was falling apart.  Beef Ribs tasted good but it wasn't much meat on them.  Sides are totally different ballgame.  Mac & cheese was super tasty and creamy with aldente pasta.  Fried okra was little bit on dry side.  BBQ beans were delicious.  French fries were good as well.  Sweet tea was delicious and freshly made.   Staff is friendly and super nice. Ambience is perfect for watching sport games on TVs all over walls (so no bad seats)  Highly recommend and will be back for sure.

xuc5eT0pFBlxYUhynnf-0g.text: First time here, we were a little confused where to order but a really friendly guy helped us out. Order first then go to the end of the counter to pay at the registers.  I got the pulled pork po'boy with Mac n cheese and beans. Plus you get a free small side with check in (can't be part of your regular order) so I got the creamed corn.   Pulled pork - absolutely delicious and flavorful  Bun - not worth it, totally soggy. Just get the meat instead. BBQ sauce - only one choice on the table but luckily it was good, slightly sweet, not very thick Mac n cheese - great flavor but could have been warmer Beans - not my favorite (as my very polite niece would say) The beans were undercooked, weird sweet flavor and a ton of stuff in there, not all identified. Creamed corn - so good! If you like corn, you'll love it. If you don't like corn then don't order corn for pete's sake!  My husband said the rib meat was falling off the bone and very good. I tried the sausage and it was very dense, interesting texture and a little too spicy for me.   Overall, great BBQ and lots of seating, TV's everywhere. Next time I want to add on corn bread for $1.50.

OH6YiD88uKg8fHF1fJVb6A.text: Food is good, price is reasonable for BBQ!  Lots of bench seating, enough TVs available to watch a game  All plates come with two sides 9.99 for one meat 17.99 for three meat plate +$5 for ribs  Lots of side options  Very tender meats!  It's hard to find good BBQ so we're happy to swing by when we're in th

0IzOTRiyukhpT_ghJcoh0g.text: Great bbq! Great bbq sauce! Never had a mustard base bbq sauce, thought about taking me home some, definitely be   2nd time there food is great! Love the country music!

dwQpymDxKXM9Rx79SnCqmQ.text: Bbq please! This local spot is surely a good bbq fix!! Atmosphere is cute! Outdoor patio style feel with bench and tables!!   Must try!

OXje4r5qGpSqxd6KsVB3BA.text: Clean restaurant with amazing food and kind staff! It reminded me of a BBQ restaurant I visited in Austin. Super authentic food and great quality.

Bzmf917hQpjlV-V9-FmMgg.text: Love the Texas Vibe! Great service and great BBQ! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Ask for the spicy bbq sauce! The have some Texas beer Shiner Bock and Lone Star!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Great service &amp; BBQ was great! Baby Back Ribs, baked Beans and the corn bread were delicious!! Yes,there&#39;s Shiner Bock and Lone Star!

TLqsS5rCr-Rdq4RrZCzq_A.text: Great bbq and atmosphere. I will be back!!! Will bring all my Old Memphis championship bbq  customers to try this great food

Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

BoKVqesQuutTQyFyagEceg.text: From someone who's eaten a lot of Texas BBQ (and a lot of brisket from Austin and Lockhart), my expectations are probably a lot higher than most.  I ordered the two meat plate - brisket and baby back ribs. The portions were huge! Full on half rack and 1/2 lb. brisket.    The brisket was a major disappointment for me especially from a self proclaimed Texas BBQ joint. I ordered the fattier side and while it wasn't overly dry, it wasn't melt in your mouth tender with amazing flavor.  It tasted as if I missed its serving prime and had been sitting heated somewhere.  I was also hoping for some nice slices with some black on the edges but instead got a pile of pulled brisket.  The baby back ribs is where we shined. The meat fell off the bones and had a nice smoky flavor. There's not much in the rub but I found the ribs to pair nicely with all their sauces which I enjoyed a lot.  Sides were good. It's rare I rave about bbq sides. Mac cheese and potato salad are as you'd expect, the bbq beans were sweeter than I prefer but if you like them sweet you'll enjoy.  All in all, Big Bs hits the spot when you're craving BBQ. It's far from calling anything "the best" but an enjoyable joint when you want some smoked meats.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby back ribs, brisket, Mac cheese, potato salad, bbq beans.

4Y_x1PBBJiJ4YvwZSe1XPg.text: Awesome service. Good food. Being that I lived in Austin TX I've had the opportunity to have the best BBQ in the world. This place stacks up pretty well. With not many option in Las Vegas for good BBQ I'll be a returning customer.

hzhjzRwTSPpJgWjk9ssCEg.text: Prepare yourself for authentic BBQ unlike any other!   You are first greeted in the parking lot by the unmistakable aroma of smoked meats, beckoning you into the humble strip mall location. But don't let the inconspicuous location and modest atmosphere deter you; when you're smoking meats at a first class level like they are, I couldn't care less what environment I'm shoveling saucy, smoked meats into my mouth- judge me all you want!   My personal favorite is the moist cut brisket. It almost melts in your mouth and is great all on its own or on a sandwich. I have also tried the pulled pork and tri tip, also both delicious. The tri tip is so tender and has a texture that makes me think of the most deluxe, steaky (great adjective!) beef jerky ever! Portions are substantial and the menu is very reasonably priced; a great way to mix up a boring lunch routine without breaking the bank.   They also have several side options; pick two with any plate or sandwich. My favorites have been their Mac and cheese as well as their fresh cut fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Texas imported wood for the smoker!

ka970R7gS-dAn6Jr249vuw.text: Ordered through postmates took a chance I hadn't ever heard of this place. Wow! Was it way way worth it!!!  The Trip-tip and brisket were the best I've had in a very long time. Very good bbq.

AoK8__Bv8IjpAI5H6EHLCQ.text: What a great place and quite a surprise.  The barbecue was delicious and well prepared.    I ordered the baby back ribs and the brisket.  The ribs were not sauced which is just the way I like them.  Ribs do not need to be drowned in sauce before they delivered.  The brisket was spot on and perfect.   It was moist but firm with a well defined smoke ring and seasoned well.  The wife ordered ribs and chicken which was equally good.   The sides were all tasty and hot.  The beans had plenty of brisket in them, the fried orca was plentiful and not soggy.   The Mac and Cheese was good stuff and it disappeared quickly.     The staff were friendly and efficient.  We met Big B ( Brian ) and he is a genuine guy with a real passion for barbecue.    We will return to this place with friends next time!

UzuS4DQPFwPKkfJBbAjZjw.text: This place is another one of my go-to places for great food -- and in this case, it's BBQ! Las Vegas is typically not associated with barbecue. Usually with the BBQ joints I've gone to, the meat is either over cooked to the point that I feel like I've bitten into shoe leather or dust, or it's undercooked and tasteless.  Enter Big B's Texas BBQ, riding in on pigs and cows pulling a technicolor smoker, spreading joy, BBQ spice dust and the smell of delicious smoke everywhere. ( Not really, but with how amazing the BBQ is, I imagine that's how they roll into Vegas every day! LOL. )  Big B's is my personal favorite BBQ joint for a reason: great service, great style, and BBQ that melts in your mouth! The restaurant itself looks like a makeshift set-up you'd find outside, with wooden tables, logs for smoking everywhere, and wire spools for chairs and tables. It really sets the tone for the food.  And oh my god, is it good BBQ. The portions are GIANT -- come in hungry and wearing some loose pants, you'll need it! I always get their brisket and baby back ribs, because those are what I use to judge a BBQ restaurant. The brisket just melts in your mouth ( Meat! Melting in your mouth! ), and you can taste the smoke in each bite. The ribs fall off the bone without much effort -- so tender and moist! I've never had ribs anywhere else that do that.  The meat is really the star of the show here, but they also have amazing sides as well. Macaroni and cheese with plenty of cheese and crusty parts, which I like; a surprisingly light and flavorful pasta salad; and corn bread muffins so fluffy that I didn't even need butter for them! They have more sides, but these are my personal favorite of the bunch.  Move on over, other BBQ joints -- Big B's really showcases what truly amazing BBQ is all about. My only complaint is that I always have to take a nap afterwards because of all the delicious food! LOL. If ever you're in Henderson and want good BBQ, run -- don't walk -- to Big B's! You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Clean bones. CLEAN. BONES. SWEET BABY JESUS.
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. My order! Brisket, baby back ribs, macaroni and cheese, pasta salad and corn bread muffins.
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. The restaurant interior. All that&#39;s missing is a country band and a mechanical bull. LOL

V48tSQo9o3xesVVx2BuN3g.text: The place was phenomenal. Some colleagues recommended the spot and it exceeded my expectations. It's also really nice set up inside the restaurant. I highly recommend it.

U0_T9jziN7YcMUle5MJIYA.text: Excellent!! Excellent!! Excellent!!!   This is the absolute best Texas BBQ in Las Vegas.   We've tried almost all the BBQ places in Vegas and this one is by far the best.  We just returned from a six week stay in Texas...and of course while we are in Texas we indulge in serious BBQ.....thinking that once we are back in Vegas we will yearn for such flavorful meats....well, yearn no more....we now have fantastic BBQ right here in our own backyard.    We tried four meats: brisket, tri tip, turkey and pulled pork....all were moist and Smokey...and four sides: potato salad, bbq beans, cream corn and mac n cheese.  The beans had a lot of bbq flavor, mac n cheese was absolutely made with real cheese, potato salad had more flavor than expected; not at all drowned in mayo (a good thing) and I really enjoyed the cream corn.   The dining area reminded me very much of a traditional Texas bbq place...yet it felt much better...very open, very clean and extremely tasteful.   The staff was very warm, attentive and they knew their meats.    An absolute must here in Vegas.

l27OszQAWd1rFRiaR0B-ag.text: Fantastic. Irma is wonderful as front of house mgr.  Pork was amazing and Cole slaw and beans were great as well.  Pork was not fatty which is key for me.  No need for sauce but theirs are good as well.  Wish they were closer to Red Rock area.

OFsCEiG5JoafPYsb3DyUqw.text: I can not recommend Big B's enough. Not only is the food great, the staff is nice, but the owners are awesome too. You really can ask for a better experience when dining out these days.   I also like the ambiance of the restaurant as well. It's low key, just like what you'd see in a Texas BBQ place. Even down to the stacked wood.   Also, it's location at St Rose and Eastern make it very easy to get to from all parts of the valley.   I'll definitely be back and tell all my friends.

Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

Qiuk1uDlyHsRJWJ6ZhHxIQ.text: Best barbecue in town great owner and his wife are very nice people very friendly employees well worth the trip to the suburbs to get great barbecue.

QGSsS9DcU3vZ4p1H_MJSRA.text: This is real Texas BBQ! A must-try BBQ joint for all local Las Vegans! Everything on the menu is delicious. I recommend the brisket, fried okra, and baked beans.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

NtITpEHhbv2SB0bvf7gnCg.text: Most of what I read was pretty darn accurate.   I liked the feel of the restaurant. Picnic tables, giant wooden spools, hanging lights and country music. We entered and were greeted right as we walked in. Got to try some samples. Those samples sold us on some of the sides. We ended up getting the tri-tip and brisket with cream corn, bbq beans and wheat bread (over the white). We also got an extra side of fried okra because I loveeeee okra and always have to get it. I also got a side of yelp sauce since I saw some one mention it in a tip and got the free pickles, jalapenos and onions.   Let me tell you that I'm always a skeptic about yelp reviews, so I usually just put tips down of what I like and what I don't like. I liked everything but the fact that the tri-tip was a tad bit too dry for me. Dipping it in the sauce definitely helped, but the yelp sauce was a creeper. We were speaking with the owner. She was super duper nice and was explaining what she could about the sauce. He husband makes it, so she wasn't 100% sure what went down.   So all-in-all, I really liked this place. The ambiance, the customer service provided and the flavors were all on point. I'm glad the meat wasn't drenched in sauce. It allows you to actually taste the meat and the mesquite wood used to smoke it. Coming back next time kuz the fried okra was so damn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

kVZAEWg1csT0ce9NFb5ncg.text: Quick and friendly service, fall off the bones ribs, tasty meats, and tangy BBQ sauce all made for a good dining experience. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

MSrMaynFsX3_KUx8KCT4tA.text: Very pleased to have come here on a Friday evening on short notice. Wasn't overly crowded and has a large seating area. Clean and well maintained. Most importantly, the food is very good! I had the beef ribs & they were delicious! A full rack of 7 meaty ribs was way too much food! I do not like overly smoked meats and these ribs were just fine! No sauce is used, either, you can add your own. As a dedicated Keto person, I appreciated that! The other people at my table really seemed to enjoy their pulled pork, chicken and sides of creamed corn, fries (looked tempting), and my 4 yr old grandson really liked his corn on the cob & especially his Mac & cheese! All in all $80+for 3 adults & a child for good quality bbq seemed fair when you allow that almost half the bill was my beef ribs ($36) & I took half of that home for later!

fPFa9wgXBaAZjtE8TYMxcA.text: I had food catered for about 20 people today for the first Sunday of Football and everything was amazing. We had pulled pork and tri tip for our meats. For sides we had mac and cheese, creamed corn and potato salad. They gave us plenty of white bread and slider rolls for sandwiches and also pickles, onions, jalapenos and sauces. Great job. I recently tried Bell's BBQ and I have to say this place is the winner.

sf2ltw1uNMjbQhwbS-MSwg.text: Best BBQ in town! Amazing food and the staff is always friendly no matter how busy they are.

vl8dfM7rWRMCFCEmdBTldQ.text: Literally the best BBQ in Henderson. It's authentic, delicious and everything you want in BBQ. The price is a little more expensive but IMO, it's worth it. You get a ton of food, so usually my fiance and I share a two meat plate. You have to ask for the spicy BBQ sauce as they keep it behind the counter so don't forget to ask bc it's amazing!

ld7-Pk_ZP2d1X8DJViy4Dw.text: I've seen this place on Instagram on UNLOKT, and then started following this place as well. I was craving BBQ the other day and decided to give them a shot. Hands down my favorite BBQ spot. Not just in Vegas/Henderson, but anywhere. I've been to multiple different BBQ places, from California to Texas. Meat was exactly how you would want it, and the sides were absolutely amazing. I recommend the Mac n cheese for sure! I got the brisket and the jalapeno and cheddar sausage. It was incredible to say the least. If you are considering going here, don't even hesitate, just go. Will 100% be back real soon!

AXgGQL7QTmopxbVYrAA5RQ.text: amazing. first time in vegas, and we visited a friend that lives out here and they recommend this place as we left. as soon as you walk in the smell of bbq hits you. as my family were first time guests they gave us a sample plate of the brisket, turkey, and the tri tip. all were outlandishly good. would highly recommend to anyone visiting the area. i might make a trip all the way from Atlanta just for it.

YkRWriD6JmN47rQRJlZukA.text: Big B's Texas BBQ has made good use of the old Jason's Deli location on St. Rose.  The smell of delicious pit barbeque hits you in the parking lot.  Once inside, their simple but kitschy picnic table, wood clad walls, and picket fence decor is somehow homey and airy at the same time.    You counter order, receive a number, pay, and grab your drink while you wait.  They have a Coke Freestyle machine, sweet and unsweetened tea, beer, and wine.  We ordered two 2-meat combos.  I got the Sliced Brisket and the Tri-tip with the mac n cheese and the BBQ beans.  Unlike some other unlucky reviewers, both my brisket and tri-tip were moist and full of flavor with a great crust and smoke ring.  If I had to pick a favorite, it would be the Tri-tip, but I'd call it close.  The beans were full of chunks of meat and are definitely the best  I have had in Vegas.  The mac and cheese was also quite delicious; creamy and definitely not bland like a lot of places.  The BF chose the Hot Link and Beef Ribs ($5 upcharge) with the slaw and beans.  The Hot Link was juicy and just a little spicy.  The Ribs didn't come out for about 10 minutes after the rest of the food and were a bit tough, but the flavor was good.  The slaw was crisp and fresh tasting, but a bit bland.  We will definitely be back to try the pulled pork, baby backs, cornbread, and other sides!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Peach cobbler and banana pudding
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Tri-tip, pulled pork, coleslaw, potato salad,and corn bread
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Babyback ribs, brisket, pasta salad, and beans.

iFsh9xKb4EoN507jpeWfnQ.text: I was in Vegas on Vacation from Texas so decided to give this place a shot. 1st i'd like to say i'm comparing this place to the BBQ served in Texas. After all the name has Texas in it so you'd of thought it would be Good! The tip off that it wouldn't be up to par w Texas was all the decor, typically if your restaurant is #1 in a strip center & #2 has cow skulls & other decor the quality probably isn't there. The staff was helpful & courteous in our ordering process explaining the menu and our options.  Let's start w the brisket, lets just say we couldn't even finish it & what we did eat we had to drown in sauce. The brisket lacked a smoke flavor yet the restaurant was pilled full of wood which is another tip its not very good. The Pork ribs had very little smoke flavor but were decent. The jalapeno cheese sausage i'd describe as being a little like jerky. The side of cream corn seemed to be missing the corn, looked like all it had was the pieces of husk's and no kernels. The corn bread had way to much cinnamon and tasted like a muffin you'd make around the holidays!   I'd encourage the owner to possibly visit Austin & Houston and check out some of the Texas Monthly TOP 50 joints to see what True Texas BBQ is like. With all that said i don't think it was terrible for Vegas, if you've heard of Dickies BBQ i'd say that is slightly below that. its just being from Texas i wouldn't eat there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

QdIL_cFzjr9j0zW0Wscebg.text: Today was our first time here... everything was SO GOOD ... we will definitely be back!!!    The macaroni and cheese was the best I've ever had, same thing with the baked beans. And the meat... so good. My husband got the hot links and the turkey breast and they were both delicious. I got the tri-tip and it was outstanding.    The restaurant was clean  with. country cute decor, with fun old time music. The owner even came by to say hello.   We will definitely be back!!

YQZQIM2T5GenKFTOCgXqhA.text: Great food...we tried the plate with 3 meat (pulled pork/brisket/smoked turkey) it was delicious my favourite was the pulled pork! My hubby loved the brisket. For sides we had the fries, the corn and the bbq beans all tasty. We will definitely come again when we will visit Las Vegas area!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

YGIL8mleQbFs5gsfQRCpzQ.text: THIS IS IT!  Real TEXAS barbecue in Las Vegas!  This Native Texan has been sorely disappointed by too many "BBQ" restaurants here, but no more!  Located next to St. Rose Siena Hospital on St. Rose Parkway, it's quite a drive from our home on the west side, but completely worth it.  The brisket comes in moist and lean cuts, they know what burnt ends are, and they make the traditional Texas sides that rival those I grew up with.  The fried okra is perfect, with homemade ranch (of course), and the mac and cheese is hearty and super cheesy.  Did I mention Shiner on draft?  But of course! This is not our first time here, but today, we met the owner, and he gave us a sample of their smoked tri-tip.  This brisket only gal might just be a convert to this more tender, flavorful cut.  A half-pound of heaven on a plate is enough for two people, with a side or two apiece.  They offer $30 all you can eat during college and NFL football games too!

tNkJEMKeXpBAD8w4Wcq2CQ.text: My second time here. We live directly across the street. Staff is very friendly. Interior design is straight up rural Texas ranch. Food is delicoious. Tastes fresh and flavorful. They have several meats and sides to choose from. The owner (big huge buff dude) walks around and makes sure customers are doing ok.   I could sit here all day relaxing and just taking in the smell of the smoker. Definately recommend!

LyeU9M5z14bhY4E0RzTbPA.text: When you walk into a place and the smell alone is enough to make your nipples hard, you know it's 5 star worthy.   Set up like a classic Texas BBQ spot with picnic tables, paper towels on the table, and a open kitchen concept this place instantly puts you at comfort. The staff here are insanely helpful and for Big B Texas BBQ virgins they really make you feel comfortable and ready for the tasty meats about to penetrate your tastebuds and your soul.   I went with the brisket plate with mac n' cheese and BBQ beans, my dinner buddy went with the Tri-Tip plate with the same sides, but added cornbread. Ya'll don't even get me started, but this was some of the best smoked meat I've had in a long time. Both the brisket and Tri-tip were criminally moist and flavorful, literally melt in your mouth amazing. I liked the tri-tip better than my brisket, but they both reigned supreme in flavorville. (Flavor Town is trademarked)  The mac n' cheese... amazing! I could eat an entire vat of this stuff and the BBQ Beans were sweet, salty, and the perfect side dish for all the meats I was enjoying. The BBQ sauces offered here are all house made and I really recommend the mustard based sauce, a mix of sweet/sour and not overly "stard" tasting. The ketchup based sauce is sweet and compliments the tri-tip and brisket perfectly. They do offer a Habanero/Ghost Pepper sauce that is out of this world good and is surprisingly not too hot, just a delightful flavor bomb. I might have taken some home with me for my eggs, pop-tarts and pretty much anything within an arm's reach.   Are you a BBQ seeker? Stop everything, your search had ended.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby back ribs. Falling off the bone.

K1-rO-OK5DDpWnQj-7bqdg.text: Place looks nice, very open and nicely decorated. Tri -tip was really good, baby back ribs were ok. Coleslaw was s lil bland, French fries good  and bbq beans had too much spices. I would come back though to try other things and have some brews.

6G2laEz8QtIBAk_FMgc0ew.text: Used them for catering a Super Bowl party... best play of the day! Two days before the game we ordered Tri tip, Brisket and Pulled Pork along with Baked Beans and Mac & Cheese.  It was ready for pick up when they said it would be, and everything was hot and delicious. Our guests LOVED everything! I'm sure they will have at least 20 new customers.  If you are looking for authentic Texas BBQ, this is the place. Friendly service and awesome food!

OL0Jx0jUwxPmMdTGUoqsQQ.text: Had Easter dinner with my hubby considering it's close to our house. I was super excited that it said Texas BBQ considering I'm a Texas girl myself who misses her hometown comfort foods. We arrived around 7:30pm in the evening and it was less crowded. I enjoyed the Texas ambiance which really made me feel like I was at home. We ordered a rack of their ribs, brisket, and hot links. Granted we arrived later in the evening, the ribs were dry and I had to add a lot of their BBQ sauce too moisten it. However, their BBQ sauce was tasty. The BBQ beans were okay (tasted better when I added sauce), mac n cheese was just ok, fried okra was probably my favorite side I tried. The corn bread didn't taste homemade, more store bought. Maybe it's me, I'm used to baked hot Texas cornbread cut in huge squares. Oh yeah, the smoked brisket was good, considering it went well with their BBQ sauce. Surprisingly the hit was the hot links, which was nice and spicy.  I'll make another visit for lunch to try their other items for consistency and the hot links. They always have coupons in the mail. I used one for our dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

qyEZdrDqmlgvUSOYXv_nnA.text: Picnic tables and wooden spool chairs, check.  String of festive bistro lights, check. Decorative picket fence, check. Gingham tray liner paper, check. Broken BBQ hopes and dreams -- check, unfortunately.  The good: Ambiance gets a solid A. No doubt about it. This restaurant has definitely put in werk-werk-werk-werk-werk and thoughtfully executed its backyard Texas picnic concept. You can't even tell it was an old Jason's Deli. Furthermore, there's ample space and seating -- I almost expected a square dance to happen in the middle of the dining area since it was so spacious. Do-si-do, here goes the bad:  Food is mediocre. I was waiting for the wow factor, but sadly, it never came. I got the #5 Po Boy with pulled pork, which comes with 2 sides. (I chose fried okra and mac+cheese, which I had to wait for. It's okay since I knew it would come out fresh.) My boyfriend got the #7 Sliders, which comes with 3, so you can choose 3 different meats. He chose the creamed corn and cornbread (which you have to pay an add'l $1.50 for). We didn't know why because the single cornbread was so tiny and dry. Actually, all the meats were pretty dry. Even when I added the sauce. The sides were the tastiest part of my meal -- Fried okra w/ ranch is good, creamed corn surprisingly good. So there's that. Sides are still contenders in the bbq battle.  I'd pick the chains at this point (Famous Dave's, Lucille's, etc) and that's not to say I haven't tried downright authentic Texan BBQ. I have! (Salt Lick and Stubb's FTW -- meaning "for the win" just to clarify, not Ft. Worth lol) I'm not a barbecue snob at all, but I'd have to agree with the other reviewers that roasted this place. We've had better.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. #5 Po Boy with pulled pork. Fried okra was good. Mac&amp;cheese still waiting for.
Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. #7 Sliders, with potato salad, creamed corn, and tiny cornbread you have to pay extra for to have as a side.

zmqgO4z2b_-HFmRmdtlBRA.text: LOVE this BBQ restaurant. We eat here at least once a month. The owner and staff are great and very friendly and the food is delicious!  We usually get the tri-tip and the beef brisket.  Highly recommend!

8YM6iJjQkAJA6TreXipihA.text: Great pulled pork sandwich! Everyone was very friendly. I highly recommend this place!

2hBPzsvS5qG4Xc8x7G0DwA.text: Located on St Rose Pkwy in the same plaza as Raising Caines and Tommy's. I had high hopes for this place after reading reviews and looking at pictures. However, we were sadly disappointed.   Let's start with the good:  1. The employees were super friendly and gladly took the time to explain the menu.  2. The facility was clean and there were plenty of places to sit.  3. All of our side dishes were delicious. We ordered the potato salad, slaw, fries and fried okra. The potato salad was flavorful and the slaw had the perfect amount of tang and sweetness. The fries and okra are fried fresh with each order so they were super hot and crispy. It was the saving grace to our meal.  4. Beef links had a decent amount of heat and a good bite to the skin.  5. The ribs had a good smokey flavor.   Now the bad.  1. The ribs and brisket were dry. Like I mean dry! Right when we sat down to eat, we could already see it. You can see in my picture how dry the ribs are if you think I'm exaggerating. The fact that we had to submerge it in BBQ sauce just shows how dry it was. We came here to get good meat, but that didn't happen.   The highlight of a BBQ place should be the meat, not the sides. And that's exactly what happened here. We left still craving that BBQ experience. I guess we still have to keep searching for a decent spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Ribs, slaw and fried okra

cAopPTSJx9bAwY80BLf8tw.text: SERVICE: My friends and I checked out this place for the VERY first time (3/1/2018). This was a great choice since I was with male carnivores, and let me tell you... the staffs were friendly, attentive, and simply amazing! They explain to you how the menu works, the different sauces, especially since it was our first time.  FOOD: Again, like mentioned before... the company I brought to this establishment were carnivorous males, and the food was quite filling. Hence, some of my friends tapped out with how the food here filled their hunger to fullest of full!   ATMOSPHERE: I loved how everything in the restaurant was efficient and straightforward. From the easy to read menus, to the seating, and the family-friendly environment. My friends and I truly enjoyed this place and will definitely return!

sS-inmWJsFCOZ_ObkWC83g.text: Texas BBQ at its finest! Everything and I mean everything here is amazing! Easily the best bbq in town. The owner came around and greeted us as we inhaled our feast. Great guy who just wants his customers to have a taste of what real Texas bbq is all about. Our faves included the ultimate bbq sandwich, fatty brisket and tri tip. The sides were just as fantastic. We had the baked beans, fried okra, Mac n cheese and fries.  Come and enjoy what real bbq is all about.

vdE3O2ZO_AKMO8F4KHQyCg.text: Food was great! The people were really nice,  the ambiance of the restaurant was very nice. Met the owner Brian All the wood he brings in from TX him self.  From start to finish it was great. As soon as you walk in the door the smell hits you. The only thing I'd change is I wish they had green beans but no biggie.  The young girl who took our order was super nice.  The guy who brought our food was nice too.  They even warmed my apple pie twice bc it took me so long to eat.  The sweet tea was great.  The picnic tables were finished well so no worries about splinters.  Loved the big TVs. Clean bathrooms. Good parking.

AFdCORHmpFtQp19BzkueLA.text: Beef ribs and brisket are the best! Brian and Natalie are customer oriented. If it's not right they will make it right. Recommend highly!

jdYUTS-NH02G_4UwFSthZg.text: Being from Texas, I naturally wanted to try this out while I was in town.  The restaurant is decorated pretty cool. You definitely get a Texas feel while being here.  Heck, they even have Shiner Beer!  Now to the food.  Texas has some wonderful BBQ places like Blacks, SaltLick, Hard Eight, Goode Company and a ton others.  I would have to say this place was pretty average.  I have had worse, but have had better.   I ordered a two meat plate - ribs and sausage with potato salad and coleslaw.  The ribs were dry and the sausage was plain.  The coleslaw wasn't good at all.  The potato salad was ok.   The BBQ sauce was nothing to talk about.  I was hopping it had more flavor.    What I would recommend to this place is work on the BBQ sauce and more flavor to the meat.  The coleslaw needs to be totally revamped.  Also, a little overpriced.  I paid $24 for my meal and gave them a $3.50 tip.    I think that this place has a good atmosphere and the staff seemed to be friendly.  It was very clean as well.  I wish them nothing but success.

yhDvkZk7l11XTEWpqk_akg.text: I'm from Texas. This stuff is great. BIG fan of the turkey and the tri tip! Mac and cheese is on point. Love that I can get my fix of that delicious brisket too! There is always room for improvement though, a few times the sides were not even warm. But nothing that a kind word of request wouldn't fix! I'll keep returning for that SMOKED meat and ICE COLD Shiner!

iyES4eMwDnC9fkBseAbaVA.text: This place is the real deal when it comes to Texas BBQ great service just a amazing experience every time

uvCkdkaPBdgfkPLq4NxVWw.text: Excellent Brisket. I enjoy the smoked Texas style bbq. Very friendly atmosphere. Very much like Rudy's original location in Texas.

VGX2HxvOjLKOHMX3z-2zvQ.text: Geez. Talk about cyber bully. The response from the manager to Princess is totally unprofessional. Princess is right about the not so good food. She is entitled her opinion and should feel ok with what she said.  That is what Yelp is all about; honest opinions. The meat is dry and tasteless, unless you put tons of sauce on it. 3TnhNNjLaQwaW-0Y-XGN6Q.text: I heard a lot of good things about this place but I was totally not impressed. Ordered brisket, it was ok lot of fat then half side ribs   They were dry like they were cooked days ahead. Beans had a funny flavor like I never tasted before maybe vinegar nasty. Potato salad had no taste lotsa bell pepper tasted  like flat potato n bell pepper. BBQ sauce they have two kinds one a red. Sauce was not good. The other a mustard based also large on vinegar. Tried it once never again too bad I wanted to like the place.

55VoiRD0ikCIOH2wztfK9A.text: OMG - I wish I would've read the bad reviews first.  I cannot believe some of the responses from the business that I was reading.  Most, if not all, of the customers that wrote about their experience and the quality of the food are NOT in the wrong for doing so and shame on her for being so condescending.  These are the types of things customers want to know before they decide on coming in and spending their money with any business.  I was finally able to coax my hubby to try out this place after almost a month of passing by here on my way to and from meetings during the day. It was about 7pm and we were greeted by a friendly guy at the beginning of the assembly line, he was very helpful in explaining the menu and made suggestions as well. Ultimately we decided to go with a 3-meat plate (brisket, tri-tip and jalapeno link w/ creamed corn and fried okra) and an order of 1/2 slab of beef ribs - all to go.  Total came to a little over $40.  They let us know that the ribs were going to take about 15 minutes to grill and as they were mentioning that, we noticed one of the employees pull out a pack from somewhere - not sure if it was a fridge or freezer and slice the slab in half.  My jaw dropped at the sight of the beef ribs, which were not the beef ribs we were used to getting that have the nice big juicy piece of meat on top of the bone...I was appalled and at an $18 price point too, I couldn't believe this is what they were serving.  Since this was our first time, I tried to keep an open mind and was hoping the flavor and quality of the other meats would redeem the rest of the meal. Nope - brisket and tri-tip were both dry and flavorless - I tried forking the brisket and it kept crumbling into sad hard pieces of rock.  Hubby tried one of the beef ribs and was ready to toss the rest - the meat on the bones was scarce and I can tell he did not enjoy any of it.  He was so upset and I felt so bad. The jalapeno link and fried okra were the only two items out of our $40+ dinner that were decent - BUT THIS IS A BBQ JOINT!  And none of the other meats met the grade...not good!  Nonetheless, I was very disappointed - I hate being wrong with new places to try when it seems like the good reviews were so abundant.  Next time I need to skip the hype and go straight to the HONEST reviews.  Try at your own risk.  Customer Service - 4 Atmosphere - 3 Food Quality - 1 Price Point - 1

al95cFp_9FJnxWt-ZJqg2Q.text: I had the one meat plate for $9.99 but had to pay an up-charge of $5 to make it pork ribs.  My Ribs were charred so much on top they were black and had a burnt taste. No sauce and couldn't taste any rub, seasoning or flavor at all. The corn on the cob was so cooled off I couldn't even melt the butter on it. Hubby had brisket. For $14.00 he got 3 slices and they were super fatty. Would not go again. For what you pay you can get much better in town. I've eaten BBQ in Texas and this wasn't even close. Will stick to Dickey's for fast food style BBQ.

jYcvW2qA94MNfdx7KRKQfw.text: Ordered out for the first time on Father's Day. We got the tri tip, ribs, pulled pork & sausage- for the sides we got Mac & cheese and creamed corn. This was some of the best BBQ I've had in Vegas! The BBQ sauce was also delicious! My favorite meat was the ribs and tri tip & both of the sides were delish! Can't wait to go back!!:)

lRqX5SBEebjVxHgED6pJ6A.text: We are regulars, the meat has been great every time we have ordered from there and so have the sides, one suggestion i have is to the fries fried twice, they need to be crispier. Other than that its all good.

i6lg-2w_HwNAOXNTK5MlWw.text: An amazing barbecue spot- great for big groups! They have tvs throughout the restaurant which is great for watching games. The baby back ribs were my personal favorite but everything we tried was spot on. If you like spicy sauce, be sure to ask for their house made hot sauce! The mac and cheese was also delicious and complimented everything I was eating. The staff was very informative about selecting the best items on the menu. Definitely the best bbq spot I've tried yet. Cant wait to be back!

8gLrmFcvI_czsK1OV3fd7Q.text: Great ribs and the tri tip was so juicy.  Will come again! Only ordered for take out. Called in was ready 15 min later when I arrived packaged with a smile.  Would like to try eating in when my two year old isn't so... two.

nnevXua-qavqOnbvwtYj5w.text: Amazing food with awesome portion size. Tender Ribs, brisket and great sides. Great seating and a very inviting atmosphere.

kszs9XMQFJYql8EQjLpReA.text: Atmosphere of the place is quite nice, came on a Sunday afternoon with my boyfriend. Not too busy, and food came out pretty fast. Guy taking the orders/line cook, Poalo, is awesome!! Friendly and helpful, it being our first time here! The service and food here is great!

DEIX9eNc8nYA_jEbctgfyw.text: Very large portions! You get your money's worth! Meats were not very seasoned, not sure if we came on an off day. I prefer my bbq to have a good dry rub and a decent amount of seasoning. But over all everything was great. Fun decor, very large and open. Will definitely be back. If the meat was seasoned better it would be 5 stars. So hopefully next time we go it will have a little more love

Su6fyZN0YPMGFNOdvzAp1w.text: Finally stopped and tried it out. Restaurant is super cute inside.   I lived in Memphis for 20 years so I've had lots of BBQ over the years.   I got the brisket. It was huge, thick pieces which were rare. Never have had rare brisket. It was good, but not great.   For my sides I had potato salad and baked beans  I did not care for the potato salad. I like almost all potato salads but not his one. It's a generous portion and had huge chunks of potatoes but just had too much stuff in it. Red onion, red pepper, something green and crunchy (?), I assume mustard and ?  Idk - just wasn't a fan. Few bites was all I could do.   Baked beans were okay. Good size portion, piping hot but were too "tangy" for my liking.   Staff was super nice.   Probably wouldn't eat here again unless I was with someone who wanted to. I would most definitely try other sides.   Don't get me wrong, I'm sure lots of people love it. Food is hot, generous portions, smells yummy -just wasn't a fan.

-CgZbSSt58Jtmv57_gL2qw.text: We came here to celebrate my sister in laws birthday and Big B's did not disappoint. We reserved a couple of tables and the family package that feeds 10-14.  The food was amazing as usual.  I am not a fan of smoked chicken but it was the birthday girls favorite item along with the Jalapeno Sausage. ( lol we got 3 pounds of it ) the creamed corn, fresh cut fries and the amazing Mac n cheese is what we had for sides.  The cashiers were so nice and kept checking in on us to see if everything was good. Which it was.  And since we had pre ordered we just waited until our whole party showed up and then we let them know when to bring the food out.  We will be back, we drove 35 minutes to get here so as long as the food and service says Amazing we will be loyal customers.

i8k_mOXWghphZkoEvylRaA.text: We came here on Saturday to support local businesses, what a great choice! People working there are super helpful when it comes to figuring out quantity and what to order. Everything was great, our kiddos loved the Mac n cheese, we gravitated towards the brisket and baby back ribs. The tea is swell too!

sl62QMPdEI0TwLAZVZIlWw.text: Very disappointed. Not what it used to be. We ordered beef ribs and they are full of fats and no meat!  We still ate them but will stop recommending these to family and friends. If you change your supplier or vendor, I suggest you ge them back! asap! Before you loose many customers. What happened to the meaty beef ribs that you used to serve?!?

Ub6y7Nsb9W0AfG3BV313uQ.text: Mr Big B looks like the Mountains little brother,  super cool dude and amazing food,  everyone screws up BBQ west of the mississippi except this guy,  Texas mesquite smoked meat as it should be!!!!!!!   Best Beef ribs anywhere and the smoked turkey will make you want to forget all about thanksgiving, its amazing!

wogkKjWXkckBEIuJ7lvURA.text: Just ate her for the first time. We lived in Houston for 20 years and missed great Bar b Que,  Big B's is the best in Vegas & we've been here 7 years.  Sandi had a 6 inch brisket hoagie and loved  it along with the potato salad and cold slaw.  I had a 2 meat plate pulled pork and beef ribs.  The smoked ribs were the best I've had in a long long time, maybe ever!Incredible taste with perfect fat content. So good I didn't want to add a very good bar b que Sauce.  The pulled pork was also delicious.  Looking around the smoked chicken and turkey looked just as good.  French fries looked incredible and fresh cut too.  The Mac and cheese looked creamy yummy good.  We look forward to a return visit so we can try these dishes & more.  One request. I love the Texas State flag on display. And all the Texas University flags but would love to see an OU flag added as well.  Since we pretty much own the others.Lol.    Don't miss this place!!!!

NXMHfifUJDl7J3abzoZwZA.text: We loved everything we ate! I'm picky about extra smoky bbq (mostly cuz I don't like that I can taste the chemicals) & big b's was perfect. Just good food & I'm definitely going back. They have this Ultimate BBQ sandwich (off the menu) that has 3 meats & 2 sides for $12.99 !!! It's ginormous.. you don't regret going

ZIUuAGBOSWvwVCuuQzoC1Q.text: Had dinner here last night. It was absolutely delicious. The brisket was tender and juicy. Mac & cheese was extra cheesy and perfect. Creamed corn was tasty as well. The perfect amount of salty and sweet! The BBQ sauce was really good. They have another yellow sauce (not sure what it was) that was yummy too!! I just wish I could order a side of burnt ends. 5TDripAFcXaweKaL36JBjQ.text: I lived in Texas for 6 years so I got used to good Texas BBQ.  Big B's comes the closest in Vegas to what I had in San Antonio.  It's a pretty big, clean place with lots of tables (note:  most of the tables are large picnic tables so if it's busy and you eat in you may be sitting with folks you don't know).  I had the three-meat combo.  That was too much food for me (and I can eat a lot).  Prices weren't bad since you get so much food for what you pay.  So if I have a hankering for Texas BBQ I'll head back to Big B's.

PYM823c4w6whvvllpQCRzg.text: I used Big B's Texas BBQ for a work function and everyone loved it.  They have good prices for groups.  The lean cut brisket was so tender and juicy.  I highly recommend stopping by here for lunch or dinner.

OK8WS75WBug7B3SBsDJSeA.text: This was the best bbq I have had outside of Texas. Everything was amazing. The ribs fell off the bone as we tried to eat them and the tri tip was fantastic. I loved the mustard based bbq sauce more that the other one. And the fried okra is great!! I highly recommend to Texans and otherwise!!!!

We had ribs and tri tip and while they weren't horrible - we kinda wished we went with the brisket and something else.   We'll likely be back, but we probably won't go out of our way to get here.

_1gmfZX_DDeWqRN89Rzuzw.text: OMG... Someone please loose my belt!!  Very good BBQ, BIG portions and it's impossible NOT to eat it all!!   You can't go wrong here.  Good atmoshphere and roomy.

zu0zym_99-ZlNCEIAguLmg.text: Very delicious and amazing! Loved that I was able to find a great tasting BBQ place! Being from Texas, I lost hope when I moved out here. Just glad to find a place that hits home to me. Tri tip and brisket were delicious, the fries and Mac and cheese were absolutely amazing. Will definitely be back

j-EFNiVlWGAZocjp5251Dg.text: This place is great! Big portions and good flavor! Staff are very friendly. Dining area is awesome!!! Picnic tables makes it feel like you're having a meal with family in your own backyard. Pecan pie is very good!!!

zB6N9HHytnJTcI8Mr2bjQg.text: Best BBQ in Henderson hands down. It might even be the best BBQ in the Las Vegas area. They are newly opened so they are still working some things out. Expect it will take you a little while to go through the line, but it is worth it.   I have been there twice.  Had their pulled pork and brisket. If possible it was even better the second time. Just walking in the place and smelling the amazing BBQ aromas is enough to make you salivate. I have to imagine the rest of the meats are as good as the two I have tried.   The bread they use for the sandwiches is really good. The sides I think are still a work in progress. They make the fries fresh when you order them and they are good. Corn on the cob is good, but the one I got wasn't particularly warm. The Mac and cheese looked great but the noodles were a little over cooked. The baked beans are great. As for the rest of the sides I can't comment, other than they look appetizing.  Staff is really friendly and nice. Dining area is clean and able to support larger groups. Hopefully they will work out the kinks in the sides, but until then the meat is more than worth the visit.

LThcf--OZ7Dk1UCYl5OpPA.text: Ordered the beef hot link, beef jalapeno and cheese hot link, pulled pork, brisket, tri tip, pork loin, creamed corn, potato salad and mac & cheese.... Food and service is absolutely amazing!!! The service is exceptional as well!!

6QNbEnt4FkglAEYz9E_UXQ.text: Wowwww what a hidden gem. The ribs and the briket are to die for! I'm so happy and it's only minutes from home. Great place. We recommend it wholeheartedly.

4YlcY0WqL4l5mfsXaWof9w.text: Been living in vegas almost 9 years.... finally just tried this place a week ago with my wife. Been here 3 times now. Love this place. Brisket tri tip and baby back ribs are probably the best I've ever had. All the side are awesome as well. Tried the meatloaf today and have to say I'm not a fan. But I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. We are customers for life!!

OsjH2id25sCJjGO1ERNLcQ.text: 25 minutes waiting for my food. I had to two people ask me for my name & yet it seemed like nobody was working on my order because it was a to-go. It seems like they tend to the people who dine in instead. Plus what was more irritating was that my food was ready and the girl just placed it down to go refill silverware by the drinks. & then someone who came 10 minutes after me and ordered way more than I did got their food before I did. Pretty upsetting.

OCdLBhDlGEj-dFhcyA0NKg.text: The moment you drive into the parking lot you can smell the delicious barbecue aroma coming from big b's! The pulled pork is perfectly seasoned and not dry at all like some places. I have to say that my favorite is the smoked turkey! I'd say try to find it somewhere else, you cant! The ambience is great when you walk in. It's perfect for a family setting or just to have some amazing shiner bock on Draft with some friends! Nothing like a Texas beer with Texas food! Did I mention they have lone star?! By far the best barbecue I've had. None of the meat is covered in sauce so you can actually taste that real smoked barbecue and rub. Real authentic Texas barbecue ladies and gents! And the service is amazing for a place that just opened!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. To die for peach cobbler with some vanilla ice cream!

HvAvLJlm-3Z-GNuCk9BNmg.text: Loved it! I could taste the smoke in the meats and very tender. My favorite meats were the tri-tip and ribs and fav side was the fried okra. The portion size is large so two 3 meat combos feed my family of four for lunch with leftovers to take home. The wait for the food was short and the staff was friendly and attentive.

ZQ526vN3j3hUCAhJ_lmdgA.text: I like the atmosphere at big b's, the food is good and they give good portions. not the best bbq in town but you don't have to wait for a table. just walk up and order so its convenient.

aEKjhfXDFGVMKl_jFnKBHA.text: Been hitting up Las Vegas metro BBQ stands that have been on my to-do list, and Big B's was next in line as they are close by and not in the mood to cook that particular evening.  A really nice brisket. More smoke flavor to it vs. Road Kill Grill, which I had a few days earlier. But, the brisket at B's was a little bit drier. Nothing terrible.  Coleslaw was on point. Very good, nothing extra ordinary. Beans were the highlight. Maybe a little too sweet, but outstanding. Fries appear to be hand cut, but were on the limp side and a little bit greasy.  Food was delivered to the table is short order. Friendly staff.  Did not try any of the sauces as a good brisket does not need the sauce.  Downer: no bread slice(s).  Will be back to try other meats.

Va6zJ9YjZoTl1Xj-SMW8Xg.text: Eehhh not the best but not the worst. I ordered the tri-tip/beef ribs and both of them lacked the signature smokey flavor that authentic Texas BBQ would have. The ribs lacked any meat and was burnt to the bone. All-in-all I would say save your money and stick to a safer choice like Lucilles!

photos.caption: Photo of Big B's Texas BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Burnt to the bone

N3hrzHnPvJagoTi1-vSjww.text: Amazing BBQ! Had a ton of questions about catering a lunch and Big Brian the Owner was so patient with me. A True gentle GIANT!! All around an amazing experiance. I love that they do not put the sauce on the meat already (for all you fellow low-carb people)
